# Rangkap Jabatan Dewan Komisaris

Board Manual mengatur ketentuan(OPengkap) jabatan Dewan Komisaris Perseroan, yaitu dilarang memangku jabatan rangkap sebagai:

1. Pengurus partai politik, anggota Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat, Dewan Perwakilan Daerah, Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah Tingkat I, dan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah Tingkat II dan/atau Kepala Daerah/Wakil Kepala Daerah;

# Board of Commissioners' Concurrent Positions

The Board Manual regulates the provisions on concurrent positions held by the Board of Commissioners' members and states the prohibition from concurrently holding positions as:

1. Officers of political parties, members of the People's Representative Council, Regional Representative Council, Regional People's Representative Council Level I, and Regional People's Representative Council Level II, and/or Regional Heads/Deputy Regional Heads;

2. Jabatan lain yang dapat menimbulkan benturan kepentingan; dan/atau  
3. Jabatan lainnya seksual dengan ketentuan peraturan perundang-undangan.

Apabila rangkap jabatan tersebutunjadi, maka命名为 jabatan anggota Dewan Komisaris berakhir segera terhitung sejak terjadinya perangkapan jabatan. Anggota Dewan Komisaris yang merangkap jabatan wajib memberitahukan kepada Perseroan secara tertulis terkait adanya rangkap jabatan, disertai dokumen pendukung. Adapun来不及 lanjut terkait rangkap jabatan, termasuk pemberhentian anggota Dewan Komisaris, mengikuti peraturan perundangan, ketentuan Anggaran Dasar, dan peraturan Perusahaan. Informasi rangkap jabatan masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris telah disampaikan pada Profil Dewan Komisaris.

# Komisaris Independen

Perseroantelahmenunjuk2 oranggangota Dewan Komisaris sebagai Komisaris Independen oleh setara dengan 40,0% dari jujiah seluruh anggota Dewan Komisaris. Dengan demikian, kondisi tersebut telah melampai total minimum yang ditentukan dalam Board Manual dan Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan No. 33/POJK.04/2014tentang Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris Emiten kepada Perusahaan Publik, yaitu wajib paling kurang 30% dari jujiah seluruh anggota Dewan Komisaris.

# Pernyataan Independensi Komisaris Independen

Posisi Komisaris Independen yang dijabat oleh Mohammad Ridwan Rizqi Ramadhani Nasution dan Gunawan Susanto telah memenuhi kriteria yang harus dimiliki sebagai memutuk dalam Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan No. 33/POJK.04/2014, berikut.

1. Bukan merupakan orang yang bekerja kepada mempunyai wewenang dan tanggung jawab untuk merencanakan, memimpin, mengendalan, kepada mengawasi kegiatan Perseroan dalam waku 6 bulan terakhir, kecuali untuk penggangkatan kembali sebagai Komisaris Independen Perseroan padaperiode berikutnya.  
2. Tidak mempunyai saham baik langsung maupun tidak langsung pada Perseroan.  
3. Tidak mempunyai hubungan afliasi dengan Perseroan, anggota Dewan Komisaris, anggota Direksi, ata Pemegang Saham Utama Perseroan.  
4. Tidak mempunyai hubungan usaha baik langsung maupun tidak langsung yang Berkaitan dengan kegiatan usaha Perseroan.

2. Other positions that may cause a conflict of interest; and/or  
3. Other positions in accordance with the provisions of laws and regulations.

If a member of the Board of Commissioners assumes a prohibited concurrent position, his/her term will immediately end upon the occurrence of such concurrent position. A commissioner with concurrent roles must formally notify the Company in writing regarding such concurrent position and provide supporting documents. Any follow-up actions on such concurrent position, including dismissal of the relevant member, will follow the laws and regulations, provisions of the Articles of Association, and Company regulations. Information on the concurrent positions of each Commissioner has been disclosed in the Board of Commissioners' profile.

# Independent Commissioner

The Company has appointed 2 members of the Board of Commissioners as Independent Commissioners, or equal to  $40.0\%$  of the total number of the Board of Commissioners' members. Thus, such condition exceeds the minimum requirement stipulated in the Board Manual and Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014 on the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners of Issuers or Public Companies, requiring at least  $30\%$  of the total number of the Board of Commissioners' members.

# Statement of Independence of the Board of Commissioners

The positions of Independent Commissioners, held by Mohammad Ridwan Rizqi Ramadhani Nasution and Gunawan Susanto, meet the criteria outlined in Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014, as follows.

1. Not currently working for or having authority and responsibility to plan, lead, control, or supervise the Company's activities in the past 6 months, except for reappointment as an Independent Commissioner for the subsequent term.  
2. Not having shares, either directly or indirectly, in the Company.  
3. Not having affiliation with the Company, members of the Board of Commissioners, members of the Board of Directors, or the Company's Major Shareholders.  
4. Not having direct or indirect business relationship related to the Company's business activities.

# Tugas, Tanggung Jawab, dan Wewenang Dewan Komisaris

Dewan Komisaris bertugas seksukan pengawasan terhadap kebijakan pengurusan, jalanya pengurusan pada umumnya baik mengenai Perseroan maupun usaha Perseroan yang dilakukan oleh Direksi dan memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi termasuk pengawasan terhadap pelaksanaan Rencana Jangka Panjang Perseroan (RJPP), Rencana Kerja dan Anggaran Perseroan (RKAP) serta ketentuan Anggaran Dasar dan Keputusan RUPS, serta peraturan perundang-undangan, untuk kepentingan Perseroan sesuai dengan maksud dan tujuan Perseroan.

Dalam menjalankan tugasnya, Dewan Komisaris memiliki wewenang untuk:

1. Memeriksa buku-buku, surat-surat, sertadokumen-dokumen lainnya, memeriksa kas untukkeperluan verifikasi dan lain-lain surat berharga danmemeriksa kekayaan Perseroan;  
2. Memasuki pekarangan, gedung, dan kantor yang dipergunakan oleh Perseroan;  
3. Meminta penjelasan dari Direksi dan/atau pejabat lainnya mengenai kegiatan usaha Perseroan dan segala persoalan yang menyangkut pengelolaan Perseroan;  
4. Mengetahui segala kebijakan dan tindakan yang telah dan akan dijalankan oleh Direksi;  
5. Meminta Direksi dan/atau pejab lainnya di bawah Direksi dengan sepengetahuan Direksi untuk menghadiri rapat Dewan Komisaris, sedangkan untuk permintaan kepada dukungan kegiatan selain rapat akan dilakukan dengan memperhatikan profesionalisme, etika, kepada pengalan Perseroan, dan organ Perseroan;  
6. Mengangkat dan memberhentikan seorang Sekretaris Dewan Komisaris;  
7. Memberhentikan sementara anggota Direksi sesuai dengan ketentuan Anggaran Dasar Perseroan;  
8. Membentuk Komite Audit, Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi, Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko, dan komite lain, jika dianggap perlu dengan memperhatikan kemampuan Perseroan;  
9. Menggunakan tenaga ahli untuk hal tertentu dan dalam jangka waktu tertentu atas menjadi Perseroan, jika dianggap perlu;  
10. Melakukan sindakan pengurusan Perseroan dalam keadaan tertentu untuk jangka waktu tertentu seksuai dengan ketentuan Anggaran Dasar;  
11. Menyetujui pengangkatan dan pemberhentian Sekretaris Perusahaan dan/atau Kepala Satuan Pengawas Intern;  
12. Meneliti dan melakukanILAah Laporan Tahunan yang disiapkan oleh Direksi serta menandatangani Laporan Tahunan tersebut;

# Duties, Responsibilities, and Authorities of the Board of Commissioners

The Board of Commissioners is responsible for supervising management policies, overseeing overall management process on both the Company and the business conducted by the Board of Directors, and providing advice to the Board of Directors, including monitoring the implementation of the Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP), the Company's Work Plan and Budget (RKAP), the provisions of the Articles of Association, the GMS resolutions, and applicable laws and regulations, for the benefit of the Company in accordance with its purposes and objectives.

In carrying out its duties, the Board of Commissioners has the following authorities:

1. Viewing books, letters, and other documents, checking cash for verification purposes and other securities and checking the Company's assets;  
2. Entering yards, buildings, and offices used by the Company;  
3. Requesting explanations from the Board of Directors and/or other officials concerning the Company's business activities and any issues related to management of the Company;  
4. Understanding all policies and actions that have been and will be carried out by the Board of Directors;  
5. Requesting the Board of Directors and/or other officials under the Board of Directors, with the knowledge of the Board of Directors, to attend the Board of Commissioners' meeting, while requests or support for activities other than the meeting will be carried out with due regard to professionalism, ethics, interests of the Company and the Company's organs;  
6. Appointing and dismissing a Secretary to the Board of Commissioners;  
7. Temporarily dismissing members of the Board of Directors in accordance with the provisions of the Company's Articles of Association;  
8. Establishing the Audit Committee, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring, and other committees if deemed necessary, by considering the Company's capabilities.  
9. Hiring experts for certain matters and for a certain period of time at the expense of the Company, if deemed necessary;  
10. Managing the Company under certain conditions for a certain period of time in accordance with the provisions of the Articles of Association;  
11. Approving the appointment and dismissal of the Corporate Secretary and/or the Head of Internal Supervisory Unit;  
12. Researching and reviewing the Annual Report prepared by the Board of Directors and signing the Annual Report;

13. Menghadiri rapat Direksi dan memberikan pandangan-pandangan terhadap hal-hal yang dibicarakan;  
14. Melaksanakan kewenangan pengawasan lainnya sepanjang tidak bertentangan dengan peraturan perundang-undangan, Anggaran Dasar, dan/atau keputusan RUPS; dan  
15. Dalam rangka menjalankan fungsi pengawasan, anggota-anggota Dewan Komisaris pada jam kerja atau waktu lain yang disepadaki, secara bersama-sama atau sendiri-sendiri, dengan atau tanpa pemberitahuan terlebih dahulu kepada Direksi, dengan memperhatikan profesionalisme, kepentingan Perseroan, publik, serta organ, memiliki hak akses termasuk namun tidak terbatas pada bangunan-bangunan dan lokasi-lokasi dari atau tempat-tempat lain yang digunakan untuk dikuasai oleh Anak Perusahaan dan memiliki hak untuk memeriksa pembukuan, surat-surat bukti, laporan, dan persediaan Barang, dan memeriksa posisi kas (untuk maksud verifikasi) dan jaminan-jaminan lainnya dan untuk mengetahui segala tindakan yang diambil oleh Direksi Anak Perusahaan yang didasari pada prinsip keterbukaan informasi dengan memperhatikan kerahasiaan Perseroan, serta dapat memberikan nasihat kepada Anak Perusahaan erkait kebjikan/tindakan yang telah diputusan maupun yang akan diambil oleh Direksi Anak Perusahaan baik diminta maupun tidak diminta.

Sejalan dengan tugas dan wewenang Dewan Komisaris tersebut, Dewan Komisaris Berkewajiban untuk:

1. Memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi dalam melaksanakan pengurusan Perseroan;  
2. Memberikan pendapat dan persetujuan RJPP, RKAP,serta rencana kerja lainnya yang disiapkan Direksi, sesuai dengan ketentuan Anggaran Dasar dan ketentuan perundang-undangan yang berlaku;  
3. Mengikuti perkembangan kegiatan Perseroan, memberikan pendapat dan saran kepada RUPS mengenai setiap masalah yang dianggap penting bagi tepengurusan Perseroan;  
4. Mengusulkan kepada RUPS penunjukan akuntan publik yang akan makukanan pemeriksaan atas buku-buku Perseroan;  
5. Meneliti dan menelaah laporan berkala dan Laporan Tahunan yang disiapkan Direksi seda menandatangani Laporan Tahunan;  
6. Memberikan penjelasan, pendapat dan saran kepada RUPS mengenai Laporan Tahunan, apabila diminta;  
7. Membuat risalah rapat Dewan Komisaris dan menyimpan salinannya;  
8. Melaporkan kepada Perseroan;mengenai kepemilikan sahamnya dan/atau keluarganya pada Perseroan tersebut dan perusahaan lain;  
9. Memberikan laporan tersebut=tugas pengawasan yang telah dilakukan selama tahun buku yang bara lampau kepada RUPS; dan

13. Attending the Board of Directors' meetings and providing views on the matters discussed;  
14. Carrying out other supervisory authorities as long as they do not conflict with the laws and regulations, the Articles of Association, and/or the GMS resolutions; and  
15. In order to carry out the supervisory function, members of the Board of Commissioners during the working hours or other agreed times, jointly or individually, with or without prior notification to the Board of Directors, by taking into account the professionalism, interests of the Company, the public, and organ, have access rights including but not limited to buildings and locations or other places used by or to be controlled by the Subsidiaries and have the right to view books, evidence, reports, and inventory, and examine the cash position (for verification purposes) and other guarantees and to find out all actions taken by the Board of Directors of the Subsidiaries based on the principle of information disclosure with due regard to the confidentiality of the Company, and can provide advice to the Subsidiaries regarding policies/actions that have been decided or which will be taken by the Board of Directors of the Subsidiaries either requested or unsolicited.

In line with its duties and authorities, the Board of Commissioners has the following obligations:

1. Providing advice to the Board of Directors regarding the management of the Company;  
2. Providing opinion and approval of the Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP), the Company's Work Plan and Budget (RKAP), as well as other work plans prepared by the Board of Directors, in line with the provisions of the Articles of Association and applicable laws and regulations;  
3. Following the development of the Company's activities and providing opinions and suggestions to the GMS on any issues deemed important for the Company's management;  
4. Proposing a recommendation to the GMS for the appointment of a public accountant to conduct an audit of the Company's books;  
5. Conducting research and reviewing the Board of Directors' periodic report and Annual Report, and signing the Annual Report;  
6. Upon request, providing the GMS with explanations, opinions, and suggestions regarding the Annual Report;  
7. Creating and keeping a copy of the Board of Commissioners' meeting minutes;  
8. Reporting to the Company on their and/or their family's share ownership in the Company and other companies;  
9. Providing a report to the GMS on the supervisory duties carried out during the most recent fiscal year; and

10. Melaksanakan kewajiban lainnya dalam rangka tugas pengawasan dan pemberian nasihat, sepanjang tidak bertentangan dengan peraturan perundang-undangan, Anggaran Dasar, dan/atau keputusan RUPS.

# Pembagian Tugas antara Dewan Komisaris

Pembagian tugas di antara anggota Dewan Komisaris diaturSEA. Untuk mendukung kelancaran pelaksanaan tugasnya, Dewan Komisaris dapat memperoleh bantuan dari Sekretaris Dewan Komisaris.

Adapun untukugas dan tanggung jawab masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris diuraikan sebagai berikut.

1. Komisaris Utama

a. Memimpin dan memastikan efektivitas kinerja Dewan Komisaris.  
b. Membuat, menerapkan, dan memberikan review/ penelahaan atas pedoman kerja/prosedur-prosedur yang Berkaitan dengan tugas Dewan Komisaris.  
c. Membuat kalender jadwal rapat Dewan Komisaris dan mengoordinasikannya dengan jajaran komite Dewan Komisaris.  
d. Mengorganisir dan menjadi apaikan agenda rapat serta memastikan bahwa Seluruh Komisaris mendapatkan informasi yang tepat waktu.  
e. Berinteraksi secara periodik dengan Direktur Utama dan bertindak sebagai penghubung antara Dewan Komisaris dengan Direksi.  
f. Memastikan informasi yang disampaikan kepada seluruh anggota Dewan Komisaris akurat, tersebut waktu, dan jelas.  
g. Memastikan komunikasi yang efektif dengan para Pemegang Saham.  
h. Mengatur evaluasi kinerja Dewan Komisaris, termasuk seluruh jajaran Komite dan Komisaris Independen, secara regular.  
i. Memfasilitasi kontribusi efektif dari Komisaris Independen dan membuat hubungan yang konstruktif di antara para anggota Dewan Komisaris.  
j. Menjalankan tugas-tugas lain seksuai permintaan RUPS dan Dewan Komisaris secara kolegial, seksuai kebutuhan dan keadaan.

2. Komisaris

a. Melakukan pengawasan terhadap kebikan pengurusan, jalanya pengurusan pada umumnya baik mengenai Perseroan maupun usaha Perseroan yang dilakukan oleh Direksi dan memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi termasuk pengawasan terhadap pelaksanaan RJPP, RKAP,{serta ketentuan Anggaran Dasar dan keputusan RUPS,serta peraturan

10. Carrying out other obligations within the scope of their supervisory and advisory duties, provided that they do not conflict with laws and regulations, the Articles of Association, and/or the GMS resolutions.

# Board of Commissioners' Division of Duties

The division of duties among the Board of Commissioners' members is regulated independently by the Board of Commissioners' members. To support the smooth execution of its duties, the Board of Commissioners may receive assistance from the Secretary to the Board of Commissioners.

The duties and responsibilities of each member of the Board of Commissioners are outlined as follows.

1. President Commissioner

a. Leading and ensuring the effectiveness of the Board of Commissioners' performance.  
b. Preparing, implementing, and providing review of work guidelines/procedures related to the Board of Commissioners' duties.  
c. Preparing a schedule for the Board of Commissioners' meeting and coordinating it with the Board of Commissioners' committees.  
d. Organizing and delivering meeting agendas and ensuring that all Commissioners receive timely information.  
e. Maintaining periodic interaction with the President Director and acting as a liaison between the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors.  
f. Ensuring that the information submitted to all members of the Board of Commissioners is accurate, timely, and clear.  
g. Ensuring effective communication with the Shareholders.  
h. Evaluating the Board of Commissioners' performance, including all Committees and Independent Commissioners, on a regular basis.  
i. Facilitating effective contributions from Independent Commissioners and establishing constructive relationships among Board of Commissioners' members.  
j. Performing other duties according to the request of the GMS and the Board of Commissioners Collegially, according to the needs and circumstances.

2. Commissioner

a. Supervising the management policies, the general course of management regarding the Company and its business conducted by the Board of Directors, and providing advice to the Board of Directors, including overseeing the implementation of the Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP), Annual Budget and Work Plan (RKAP), as well as the provisions of the Articles

perundang-undangan, untuk kepentingan Perseroan seksuai dengan maksud dan tujuan Perseroan.

b. Memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi dalam melaksanakan pengurusan Perseroan, memberikan pendapat dan persetujuan RJPP, RKAP, serta rencana kerja lainnya yang disiapkan Direksi sesuai dengan ketentuan Anggaran Dasar dan ketentuan perundang-undangan yang berlaku, mengikuti perkembangan kegiatan Perseroan, memberikan pendapat dan saran kepada RUPS mengenai setup masalah yang dianggap penting bagi kepengurusan Perseroan, serta mengusulkan kepada RUPS terkait penunjukan akuntan publik yang akan melakukan pemeriksaan atas buku-buku Perseroan.

# 3. Komisaris Independen

Komisaris Independen merupakan anggota Dewan Komisaris yang tidak teraflialis dengan Direksi, anggota Dewan Komisaris lainnya, dan Pemegang Saham Pengendali, seda bebas dari hubungan bisnis kepada hubungan lainnya yang dapat memengaruhi kemampuanya untuk bertindak ataubertindak semata-mata demi kepentingan Perseroan.

Komisaris Independen memiliki tanggung jawab pokok untuk mendorong diterapkannya prinsip GCG di dalam Perseroan melalui pemberdayaan Dewan Komisarisagar dapat makukutan tugas pengawasan dan pemberian nasihat kepada Direksi secara efektif dan lebih memberikan nilai tambah bagi Perseroan. Selain itu, Komisaris Independen juga memiliki tugas sebagai berikut.

a. Menjamin transparansi dan keterbukaan Laporan Keuangan Perseroan.  
b. Memberikan perilakuan yang adil terhadap Pemegang Saham minoritas dan pemangku kepentinganyang lain.  
c. Mengungkapkan transaksi yang mengandung benturan kepentingan secara wajar dan adil.  
d. Memastikankeptuhan Perseroan pada perundangan dan peraturanyang berlaku.  
e. Menjamin akuntabilitas organ Perseroan.

Selainitu,dalam upaya untuk melaksanakan tanggung jawabnya dengan baik,make Komisaris Independen harus secara proaktif tersebutpengupayakan agar Dewan Komisaris melakukan pengawasan dan memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi yang terkait dengan, namuntidak terbatas pada hal-hal sebagai berikut.

a. Memastikan menjadi Perseroan memiliki strategi bisnis yang efektif, termasuk didalamnya memantau jalwal, anggaran dan efektivitas strategi tersebut.  
b. Memastikan命名为 Perseroan mengkat eksekutif dan manager-manager professional.

of Association and the GMS resolutions, as well as applicable laws and regulations, in the best interest of the Company in accordance with its objectives and purposes.

b. Providing advice to the Board of Directors in managing the Company, offering opinions and approvals on the Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP), Annual Budget and Work Plan (RKAP), and other work plans prepared by the Board of Directors in accordance with the provisions of the Articles of Association and applicable regulations, monitoring the Company's activities, providing opinions and recommendations to the GMS on any matters deemed important for the Company's management, and proposing to the GMS the appointment of a public accountant to audit the Company's financial statements.

# 3. Independent Commissioner

An Independent Commissioner is a member of the Board of Commissioners who is not affiliated with the Board of Directors, other members of the Board of Commissioners, or the Controlling Shareholder and is free from any business or other relationships that may affect the ability to act solely in the interest of the Company.

The primary responsibility of an Independent Commissioner is to encourage the implementation of GCG principles within the Company by empowering the Board of Commissioners to effectively carry out its supervisory and advisory duties to the Board of Directors, thereby adding value to the Company. In addition, the Independent Commissioner also has the following duties.

a. Ensuring the transparency and disclosure of the Company's Financial Statements.  
b. Ensuring fair treatment of minority Shareholders and other stakeholders.  
c. Disclosing transactions that contain conflicts of interest in a proper and fair manner.  
d. Ensuring the Company's compliance with applicable laws and regulations.  
e. Guaranteeing the accountability of the Company's organs.

Furthermore, to fulfill responsibilities effectively, the Independent Commissioner must proactively ensure that the Board of Commissioners supervises and provides advice to the Board of Directors regarding, but not limited to, the following matters.

a. Ensuring that the Company has an effective business strategy, including monitoring the schedule, budget, and effectiveness of the strategy.  
b. Ensuring that the Company appoints executives and professional managers.

c. Memastikan bahwa Perseroan.), informasi,istem pengendalian, dan systemd audit yang bekerja dengan baik.  
d. Memastikan telah Perseroan mematuhi hukum dan perundangan yang berlaku maupun nilai-nilai yang ditetapkan Perseroan dalam menjalankan operasinya.  
e. Memastikan risiko dan potensi krisis sealing diidentifikasi dan dikelola dengan baik.  
f. Memastikan prinsip-prinsip dan praktik GCG dipatuhi dan diterapkan dengan baik.

# Keputusan yang Perlu Mendapat Persetujuan Dewan Komisaris

Keputusan-keputusan yang perlu mendapat persetujuan dari Dewan Komisaris sebelum diimplementasikan Perseroan diuraikan sebagai berikut.

1. Persetujuan erkait perbuatan tertentu oleh Direksi, yaitu:

a. Kegiatan penyertaan modal (investasi) dan/atau pelepasan penyertaan modal (divestasi); dan  
b. Perbuatan lain sebagai diatur dalam Anggaran Dasar yang tidak termasuk dalam kegiatan penyertaan modal (investasi) dan/atau pelepasan penyertaan modal (divestasi).

2. Perbuatan tertentu sebagaimana diatur dalam Anggaran Dasar Perseroan dengan nilai di atasatas kewenangan Direksi.

Pada tahun 2024, Dewan Komisaris telah mengeluarkan dan/atau menuyetujui menjadi keputusan, di antaranya:

1. Persetujuan pelaksanaan pengadaan Auditor Laporan Keuangan;  
2. PersetujuanatasRJPPperiode2025-2029;  
3. Persetujuan atas RKAP tahun 2025; dan  
4. Persetujuanatasrencanaaksi korporasi,yaitu projek akuisisi perusahaan fiber (PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi) pada akhir tahun 2024.

# Rapat Dewan Komisaris

Dewan Komisaris diwajibkan untuk melaksananRAPAT internal minimal 1 kali dalam 2 bulan. Dewan Komisaris juga diwajibkan untuk melaksananRAPAT bersama Direksi minimal 1 kali dalam 4 bulan. PelaksanaanRAPAT dapat dilakukan secara langsung ataupun telekonferensi dengan tetap memperhatikan keabsahan pengambilan keputusan. Pada tahun 2024, tingkat kehadiran Dewan Komisaris dalamRAPAT internal danRAPAT gabungan ditunjukkan sebagai berikut.

c. Ensuring that the Company has effective information, control system, and audit system.  
d. Ensuring that the Company complies with applicable laws and regulations as well as the values set by the Company in performing its operations.  
e. Ensuring that risks and potential crises are always identified and properly managed.  
f. Ensuring that GCG principles and practices are properly adhered to and implemented.

# Decisions Requiring Board of Commissioners’ Approval

The decisions that require the Board of Commissioners' approval before being implemented by the Company are outlined as follows.

1. Approval related to certain actions by the Board of Directors, as follows.

a. Equity participation activities (investment) and/or divestment of equity participation(divestment); and  
b. Other actions as stipulated in the Articles of Association that are not included in capital participation (investment) and/or divestment activities.

2. Certain actions as stipulated in the Company's Articles of Association with a value exceeding the authority limit of the Board of Directors.

In 2024, the Board of Commissioners issued and/or approved several decisions, among others:

1. Approval of the procurement of the Financial Statements Auditor;  
2. Approval of the Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP) for the 2025-2029 period;  
3. Approval of the 2025 Company's Budget and Work Plan (RKAP); and  
4. Approval of the corporate action plan, namely the acquisition project of a fiber company (PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi) at the end of 2024.

# Board of Commissioners' Meeting

The Board of Commissioners is also required to hold joint meetings with the Board of Directors at least once every 4 months. Meetings may be conducted in person or via teleconference while ensuring the validity of decision-making. # Pelaksanaan Tugas Dewan Komisaris

Sepanjang tahun 2024, Dewan Komisaris Perseroan telah melaksanan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya yang meliputi:

1. Melaksanakan rapat rutin Dewan Komisaris untuk menerima laporan tersebut merumusan keputusan berdasarkan pembahas dan dalam komite-komite Dewan Komisaris, termasuk Komite Audit, Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi,ILA komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko;

The Board of Commissioners' attendance at the 2024 GMS has been presented in the General Meeting of Shareholders section.

# Implementation of Board of Commissioners' Duties

Throughout 2024, the Board of Commissioners carried out its duties and responsibilities, including:

1. Conducting regular Board of Commissioners' meetings to receive reports and formulate decisions based on discussions of the Board of Commissioners' committees, including the Audit Committee, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, and the Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring;

2. Melaksanakan rapat gabungan dengan Direksi secara rutin menjadi bagian dari pengawasan dan pemberian arahan terkait kinerja, pengelolaan manajemen risiko, dan;penerapan GCG, serta berbagai aspek strategis lainnya;  
3. Melaksanakan kunjungan (site visit) ke lokasi aset Mitratel di Ibukota Nusantara (IKN) - Kalimantan, Manado, Makassar, Semarang, Bali, Bojonegoro, Surabaya, dan Bandung untuk mendapatkan gambaran langsung mengenai kondisi di lapangan serta dinamika pengelolaan operasional, khususnya terkait optimasidi dan efisiensi sewa lahan;  
4. Penetapan RJPP 2025-2029 dan RKAP 2025;  
5. Memberikan konsultansi, arahan, persetujuan, dan/atau permintaan kajian ulang atas rencana{serta pelaksanaanaksi korporasi perusahaan, setelah melalui pembahasandi Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko;  
6. Melaksanakan evaluasi atas profil risiko perusahaan, baik untukahun berjalan(2024) maupun projeksi tahun 2025;  
7. Melaksanakan evaluasi dan persetujuan terhadap penilaian key performance indicator Direksi, setelah melalui pembahasan mendalam di Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi;  
8. Melaksanakan review sera memberikan masukan atas tindak lanjut Laporan Program Kerja Audit Tahunan dan Program Kerja Non-Audit Tahunan yang disampaikan oleh Komite Audit;  
9. Memberikan persetujuan atas lingkup pekerjaan audit, termasuk aduit atas Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan tersebut Owner's Estimated Beban Audit tahun buku 2024; dan  
10. Menerima laporan, mangevaluasi, memonitor, ada memberikan masukan bila diperlukan terkait tindak lanjut penanganan whistleblower, sebagai disampaikan oleh Komite Audit.

# Pengembangan Kompetensi Dewan Komisaris

# Kebijakan Pengembangan Kompetensi Dewan Komisaris

Board Manual telah mengatur kebijakan terkait pengembangan kompetensi Dewan Komisaris. Program peningkatan kompetensi bagi Dewan Komisaris bertujuan menc Gatkan efektivitas kerja. Anggota yang mengikut program tersebut seminar atas pelatihan wajib memberikan presentasi kepada anggota lainnya untuk berbagi informasi dan menjadi laporan pelaksanaan program yang disampaikan kepada Dewan Komisaris.

Programpeningkatankompetensi yangapatdiikutileh DewanKomisarisantara lain:

1. Pengetahuan berkaitan dengan prinsip-prinsip hukum korporasi dan peraturan perundang-undangan yang berhubungan dengan kegiatan usaha Perseroan, atau systemd pengendalian internal;

2. Holding joint meetings with the Board of Directors regularly as part of supervision and guidance regarding performance, risk management, GCG implementation, and various other strategic aspects;  
3. Conducting site visits to Mitratel asset locations in Nusantara Capital City (IKN) - Kalimantan, Manado, Makassar, Semarang, Bali, Bojonegoro, Surabaya, and Bandung to gain direct insights into on-site conditions and the dynamics of operational management, particularly related to land lease optimization and efficiency;  
4. Establishing the 2025-2029 Company's Long-Term Plan (RJPP) and the 2025 Company's Work Plan and Budget (RKAP);  
5. Providing consultation, guidance, approvals, and/or requests for reassessment of corporate action plans and implementation, following discussions in the Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring;  
6. Conducting evaluations of the Company's risk profile, both for the current year (2024) and projections for 2025;  
7. Conducting evaluations and approvals of the Board of Directors' key performance indicator assessments, following in-depth discussions in the Nomination and Remuneration Committee;  
8. Reviewing and providing input on the follow-up actions of the Reports of Annual Audit Work Program and Annual Non-Audit Work Program, as presented by the Audit Committee;  
9. Approving the scope of audit work, including the audit of the Company's Consolidated Financial Statements and the Owner's Estimated Audit Expenses for the 2024 fiscal year; and  
10. Receiving reports, evaluating, monitoring, and providing input, if necessary, regarding the follow-up actions on whistleblower handling, as reported by the Audit Committee.

# Orientation/Induction Program for New Members of the Board of Commissioners

The Company implements a policy to conduct an induction program for newly appointed members of the Board of Commissioners. This program aims to ensure that new members become familiar with and gain a comprehensive understanding of all aspects related to their roles and responsibilities. Furthermore, this program can help align their perception of GCG implementation within the Company, enabling them to adapt quickly and contribute effectively. The implementation of orientation/induction program is the responsibility of the Corporate Secretary or the party performing the function of Corporate Secretary.

The materials presented in the induction program for newly appointed members of the Board of Commissioners at least include the following matters.

1. Introduction of the Company including its vision, mission, strategy, performance, financial condition, risks, and the latest developments of the Company;

2. Pemahaman ingin industri telekomunikasi, termasuk pengetahunan ingin Produk-produk Perseroan;  
3. Pemahamanterhadapregulasidan kebikan pemerintah, khususnya terhadap industri telekomunikasi;  
4. Pemahaman terhadap aspek financial (financial literacy), khususnya terkait pemeriksaan Laporan Keuangan, termasuk namun tidak terbatas pada neraca keuangan, laporanlabarugi, laporanaruskas, danlaporan perubahan ekuitas, serta catatan atas laporan keuangan perusahaan terbuka;  
5. Pelaksanaan prinsip-prinsip GCG di Perseroan, Governance, Risk and Compliance yang terintegrasi, dan whistleblowing system, termasuk etika dan norma yang berlaku di lingkungan Perseroan;  
6. Pengetahuan yang berkaitan dengan ESG dan Environmental, Social, and Governance dans sustainability reporting yang berlaku di Perseroan berdasarkan ketentuan peraturan perdangundangan dan Anggaran Dasar;  
7. Sharing session dengan pemangku kebujakan maupun regulator;  
8. Pengetahuan berkaitan dengan hukum keuangan negara dan pencegahan tindak pidana korupsi;  
9. Peran, tugas, dan tanggung jawab Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi, termasuk Internal Audit dan Komite,serta organ pendukung lainnya;  
10. Perkenalan dengan jajaran manajemen dan kunjungan ke masing-masing Unit Perseroan; dan  
11. Team Building yang menyertakan tersebut anggota Dewan Komisaris, baik yangbaru menjadi maupun yang pernah menjadi sebelumnya dengan tujuan mewujudkan kekompakan dan kerja sama tim sebagai Dewan Komisaris.

Penyusunan materi program pengenalan terlebih dahulu memperhatikan arahan Direksi dan mempertimbangkan nasihat Dewan Komisaris. Paling lambat 3 bulan setelah program pengenalan dilakukan, Sekretaris Perusahaan ataupun pihak yang menjalankan fungsi Sekretaris Perusahaan wajib melakukan evaluasiterhadap pelaksanaan program pengenalan tersebut. Pada tahun 2024, Perseroan tidak melaksanan program pengenalan bagi Dewan Komisaris karena tidak ada anggotabaru yang diangkat.

# Penilaian Kinerja Dewan Komisaris Berdasarkan Self-Assessment

1. Kebijakan, Prosedur, dan Pelaksanaan Penilaian Kinerja

Berdasarkan Peraturan Bersama Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. 060/DEKOM-DMT/10/2024 dan No. PD 0009/HK 200/DMT-11120000/2024, terdapat kebikan untuk penilaian sendiri (self-assessment) yang diungkapkan pada Laporan Tahunan. Kebikan ini dirancang untuk memastikan akuntabilitas dan mendukung upaya pengkatan kinerja Dewan Komisaris secara berkesinambungan.

Self-assessment dilakukan oleh masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris untuk mengevaluasi/menilai pelaksanaan kinerja Dewan Komisaris secara kolegial. Kebijakan ini tidak dimaksudkan untuk menilai kinerja individu anggota Dewan Komisaris, melainkan fokus pada pencapaian molektif Dewan Komisaris sebagai situ kesatuan. Dengan pendekatan ini, setup anggota Dewan Komisaris diharapkan dapat berkontribusi dalam memperbaiki dan menc Gatkan kinerja Dewan Komisaris secara keseluruhan dan berkesinambungan.

Self-assessment anggota Dewan Komisaris dilakukan oleh komite yang menjalankan fungsi nominasi dan remunerasi, yang diketuai oleh sudah situ anggota Dewan Komisaris. Penilaian ini mencakup tujuan dan maksud pelaksanaannya, dilakukan secara Berkala sesuaijadwalyang ditetapkan,sertamenggunakantolok ukur ata kriteria penilaian yang telah direkomendasikan oleh Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi.

# Board of Commissioners' Performance Assessment Based on Self-Assessment

1. Policy, Procedure, and Implementation of Performance Assessment

According to the Joint Regulation of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. 060/DEKOM-DMT/10/2024 and No. PD 0009/HK 200/DMT-11120000/2024, there is a self-assessment policy disclosed in the Annual Report. This policy is designed to ensure accountability and support continuous improvement in the Board of Commissioners' performance.

The self-assessment is conducted by each member of the Board of Commissioners to evaluate/assess the Board of Commissioners' performance collectively. This policy is not intended to assess the individual performance of Board of Commissioners' members but focuses on the collective achievements of the Board of Commissioners as a whole. Through this approach, each Board of Commissioners' member is expected to contribute to improving and enhancing the overall and continuous performance of the Board of Commissioners.

The Board of Commissioners' self-assessment is conducted by the committee performing nomination and remuneration functions, chaired by one of the Board of Commissioners' members. This assessment includes its objectives and purposes, is carried out periodically according to a predetermined schedule, and utilizes benchmarks or evaluation criteria recommended by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee.

# 2. Kriteria Penilaian

Evaluasi dilakukan berdasarkan kriteria yang telah disusun, yaitu tersebut GCG, aspirasi Pemegang Saham, tersebut absolute target untuk RKAP dan KPI,{serta ketentuan perundang-undangan,dengan mempertimbangkan rekomendasiluri Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi.

# 3. Hasil Penilaian

Pada tahun 2024, hassle penilaian kinerja Dewan Komisaris menunjukkan Dewan Komisaris telah menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya dengan baik. Hal ini juga terefteksi pada kondisi Perseroan yang menunjukkan kinerja yang baik di tengah tantangan dan dinamika ekonomi sepanjang tahun 2024.

# Penilaian Kinerja Komite di Bawah Dewan Komisaris

# Kebijakan, Prosedur, Pelaksanaan, dan Pihak yang Melakukan Penilaian Kinerja

Dewan Komisarispekukan penilaianatas kinerja komite di bawah Dewan Komisaris setiap akhir tahun buku dengan mempertimbangkanhasil laporan penugasan dan laporatanahan pelaksanaan kegiatan dari komite di bawah Dewan Komisaris.

Berdasarkan Board Manual yang diterbitkan pada 30 Oktober 2024, penilaian kinerja komite di bawah Dewan Komisaris dilakukan melalui self-assessment oleh Komite Dewan Komisaris yang membidangi nominasi dan remunerasi. Pada tahun 2024, telah penilaian menujukkan bahwa seluruh komite mencapai pencapaian kinerja  $100\%$ , dengan rincian sebagai berikut.

# 1. Komite Audit:

a. Melakukan review dan supervisi terhadap rencana serta pelaksanaan Program Kerja Audit Tahunan (PKAT) dan Program Kerja Non-Audit Tahunan (PKNAT), dengan pencapaian  $100\%$ ;  
b. Menindaklanjuti disposisi kegiatan Dewan Komisaris yang membutuhkan kajian lebih lanjut, dengan pemenuhan  $100\%$ ; dan  
c. Melaksanakan evaluasi dan memberikan rekomendasi terkait rencana penunjukan auditor dan/atau kantor akuntan publik, dengan pencapaian  $100\%$ .

2. Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko:

a. Melakukan evaluasi terhadap performa Perseroan sesuai dengan rencana kerja tahun, dengan pencapaian  $100\%$ ;  
b. Melaksanakan review dan memberikan nasihat atas RJPPILA rencanaaksi korporasi,dengan pencapaian  $100\%$  ;dan

# 2. Assessment Criteria

The assessment is based on predetermined criteria, including the implementation of GCG, Shareholder aspirations, the application of absolute target for the Company's Work Plan and Budget (RKAP) and Key Performance Indicators (KPI), as well as laws and regulations, while considering recommendations from the Nomination and Remuneration Committee.

# 3. Assessment Results

In 2024, the performance assessment results of the Board of Commissioners indicated that the Board of Commissioners effectively carried out its duties and responsibilities. This was also reflected in the Company's strong performance despite the economic challenges and dynamics throughout the year.

# Performance Assessment of Committees Under the Board of Commissioners

# Policies, Procedures, Implementation, and Party Conducting Performance Assessment

The Board of Commissioners assesses performance of the committees under its supervision at the end of each fiscal year, by considering the assignment report and annual activity report submitted by the committees.

Based on the Board Manual issued on October 30, 2024, the performance evaluation of committees under the Board of Commissioners is conducted through self-assessment by the Board of Commissioners Committee responsible for nomination and remuneration. In 2024, the assessment results indicated that all committees achieved  $100\%$  performance, with the following details.

# 1. Audit Committee:

a. Conducting review and supervision of the planning and implementation of the Annual Audit Work Program (PKAT) and the Annual Non-Audit Work Program (PKNAT), achieving  $100\%$ ;  
b. Following up on the disposition of Board of Commissioners' activities requiring further review, with  $100\%$  fulfillment; and  
c. Conducting evaluations and providing recommendations regarding the plan for appointing auditors and/or public accounting firms, achieving  $100\%$ .

2. Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring:

a. Evaluating the Company's performance in accordance with the annual work plan, achieving  $100\%$ ;  
b. Conducting reviews and providing advice on the RJPP and corporate action plans, achieving  $100\%$ ; and

c. Melaksanakan monitoring terhadap implementasi enterprise risk management, dengan pencapaian  $100\%$ .

3. Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi:

a. Tidak terdapat disposisi Dewan Komisaris yang membutuhkan kajian lebih lanjut oleh komite, Seeingga pemenuhan dianggap  $100\%$ ; dan  
b. Tidak ada usulan calon Direksi dan/atau Komisaris untuk tahun 2024, sehingga pemenuhan dianggap  $100\%$ .

# Kriteria Penilaian

Kriteria yang digunakan dalam penilaian kinerja mencakup tingkat participasi anggota Dewan Komisaris dalam rapat dan kegiatan Perseroan,serta pencapaiant target dan sasaran kerja, baik dalam menjalankan fungsinya sebagai anggota Dewan Komisaris maupun sebagai anggota komite.

# Hasil Penilaian

Pada tahun 2024, seluruh komite di bawah Dewan Komisaris telah menuunjukkan kinerja yang baik, yang diuraikan sebagai berikut.

# Assessment Criteria

The performance assessment criteria include the level of participation of the Board of Commissioners' members in meetings and Company activities, as well as the achievement of targets and work objectives in their roles as both member of the Board of Komisaris maupun(SEbagai anggota komite.

# Assessment Results

In 2024, all committees under the Board of Commissioners demonstrated strong performance, as outlined below.

1. Audit Committee

The Audit Committee is assessed to have performed excellently in carrying out its oversight function for the Board of Commissioners. Throughout 2024, the Audit Committee actively participated in:

a. Monitoring and overseeing the audit process conducted by independent auditors;  
b. Evaluating and providing recommendations on internal and external audit results;  
c. Regularly reviewing the Consolidated Financial Statements; and  
d. Evaluating and providing recommendations related to Mitratel's risk profile.

Furthermore, the Audit Committee also supervises and ensures follow-up actions on the whistleblowing process, from report submission to settlement and further actions. These complaints are managed through Mitratel Integrity Line, a whistleblowing system provided by Mitratel Management. This commitment strengthens the Company's efforts in managing compliance risks and ensuring the effective implementation of Good Corporate Governance (GCG).

2. Nomination and Remuneration Committee

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee has been assessed as having a satisfactory performance by providing various strategic recommendations, including:

a. Formulating KPIs for the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners; and  
b. Recommending remuneration for the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners to the Shareholders.

Selainitu, komite juga seksukan evaluasi sebagai dasar dalam memberikan masukan kepada Direksi terkait pengelolaan Human Capital Management. Evaluasi ini merupakan来不及 lanjut dari Maturity Assessment yang dilakukan oleh Kementrian BUMN, yang mencakup:

a. Sistem pengembangan SDM;  
b. Sistem rekrutmen dan akuisisi talenta;  
c. Sistem manajemen kinerja;  
d. Sistem remunerasi; dan  
e. Sistem pengelolaan karier dan manajemen talenta.

Aktivitas yang dijalankan oleh Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi mencerminkan perhatian tinggi terhadap pengelolaan sumber daya manusia sebagai faktor utama dalam mendukung pengembangan bisnis dan keberlanjutan perusahaan.

3. Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko

Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko dinilai memiliki kinerja yang sarat baik dalam aktivakan evaluasi menyeluruh terhadap RJPP dan RKAP. Komite ini berperan dalam:

a. Memastikan keselarasan implementasi RKAP dengan sasan yang telah disetujui;  
b. Mengawasi program investasi Perseroan dalam RKAP, termasuk implementasi program value growth story dan penyerapan anggaran strategi; dan  
c. Memantau enterprise risk management dan project risk management untuk proyek strategis yang telah mendapat persetujuan Dewan Komisaris.

Penilaian ini mencerminkan komitmenkuatkomitedalam memastikan efektivitas perencanaan strategiserta mitigasi risiko,baik yang terkait dengan risikostrategis,financial,maupun operasional.

Moreover, the committee conducts evaluations as a basis for providing input to the Board of Directors regarding Human Capital Management. This evaluation is a follow-up to the Maturity Assessment conducted by the Ministry of SOEs, covering:

a. Human resource development system;  
b. Recruitment and talent acquisition system;  
c. Performance management system;  
d. Remuneration system; and  
e. Career management and talent management system.

The activities carried out by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee reflect a strong focus on human resource management as a key factor in supporting business development and corporate sustainability.

3. Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring

Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring has been assessed as performing exceptionally well in conducting a comprehensive evaluation of the RJPP and RKAP. This committee plays a role in:

a. Ensuring the alignment of RKAP implementation with approved targets;  
b. Overseeing the Company's investment programs within the RKAP, including the implementation of value growth story program and strategic budget absorption; and  
c. Monitoring enterprise risk management and project risk management for strategic projects that have received approval from the Board of Commissioners.

This assessment reflects the committee's strong commitment to ensuring the effectiveness of strategic planning and risk mitigation, covering strategic, financial, and operational risks.

# Board of Directors

Direksi diamanatkan oleh Pemegang Saham untuk mengelola Perseroan. Setiap anggota Direksi secara pribadi, seda secara kolektif, bertanggung jawab untuk keseluruhan kinerja Perseroan.

# Pedoman Kerja Direksi

Perseroan telah memiliki Panduan Tata Kerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi (Board Manual), yang ditetapkan dalam Peraturan Bersama Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. 060/DEKOM-DMT/10/2024 dan No. PD. 0009/HK 200/DMT-11120000/2024 tersebut Panduan Tata Kerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi (Board Manual) PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk, yang berlaku sejak 30 Oktober 2024. Board Manual dijadikan pedoman bagi Direksi dalam pelaksanaan kerja Direksi secara efektif, efsien, dan transparan,serta berdasarkan prinsip-prinsip GCG dalam mewujudkan visi, misi, dan nilai Perseroan, khususnya berdasarkan Anggaran Dasar Perseroan dan perundang-undangan yang berlaku pada umumnya.

# Komposisi Direksi

Sesuai dengan Board Manual, kompositi Direksi minimal terdiri dari 2 orang, denganalah statunya diangkat sebagai Direktur Utama. Pengangkatan dan pemberhentian Direksi menjadi wewenang RUPS. Masajabatan Direksi telah selama 5 tahun dan dapat diangkat kembali untuk 1 kaliASA jabatan. Pada tahun 2024, kompositi Direksi terdiri dari 5 orang, yaitu:

The Board of Directors is mandated by the Shareholders to manage the Company. Each member of the Board of Directors, both individually and collectively, is responsible for the overall performance of the Company.

# Board of Directors Charter

The Company has established the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors Work Guidelines (Board Manual), as stipulated in the Joint Regulation of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. 060/DEKOM-DMT/10/2024 and No. PD. 0009/HK 200/DMT-11120000/2024 on the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors Work Guidelines (Board Manual) of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk, effective as of October 30, 2024. The Board Manual serves as a guideline for the Board of Directors in carrying out the duties effectively, efficiently, and transparently, in line with GCG principles to realize the Company's vision, mission, and values, particularly based on the Company's Articles of Association and applicable laws and regulations.

The appointment and dismissal of Board of Directors are under the GMS authority. The term of office for the Board of Directors is 5 years and may be renewed for 1 additional term. # Concurrent Positions of the Board of Directors

The Board Manual regulates the concurrent positions held by the Board of Directors, stipulating that Directors are prohibited from holding concurrent positions as:

1. Members of the Board of Directors in State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), Regional-Owned Enterprises (BUMD), and privately-owned enterprises;  
2. Members of the Board of Commissioners and/or Supervisory Board in other state-owned enterprises;  
3. Members of the Board of Directors or Board of Commissioners in other companies that:

a. Operate within the same relevant market;  
b. Have a close connection in terms of business sector and/or type of business; or  
c. Together with the Company, could dominate the market share of certain goods and/or services, potentially leading to monopolistic practices and/ or unfair business competition.

4. Structural and functional positions in central and regional government institutions/agencies;  
5. Administrators of political parties, members of the House of Representatives (DPR), Regional Representative Council (DPD), Regional House of Representatives Level I (DPRD I), Regional House of Representatives Level II (DPRD II), and/or Regional Heads/Deputy Regional Heads;  
6. Candidatesormembers of the Houseof Representatives (DPR), Regional Representative Council (DPD), Regional House of Representatives Level I (DPRD I), Regional House of Representatives Level II (DPRD II), or Candidates for Regional Head/Deputy Regional Head;  
7. Other positions that may cause conflicts of interest; and  
8. Other positions as stipulated by applicable laws and regulations.

For any concurrent positions held by the Board of Directors that are not mentioned above, approval from the Board of Commissioners is required. The tenure of a member of the Board of Directors who holds a concurrent position as referred to will end as soon as the dual position occurs. The members of Board of Director whose tenure ends must notify the Company in writing, accompanied by supporting documents related to the concurrent position. Further actions regarding the rights, obligations, and termination of the Director due to holding a dual position will follow the provisions of applicable laws and regulations, the Company's Articles of Association, and internal Company regulations. Information on each Director's concurrent positions has been disclosed in the Directors' Profile.

# Duties, Responsibilities, and Authorities of the Board of Directors

The primary duty of the Board of Directors is to carry out all actions related to and responsible for managing the Company in the Company's best interests and in accordance with its objectives and purposes. The Board of Directors also represents the Company, both in and out of court, on all matters and events, subject to the limitations set forth in laws and regulations, the Articles of Association, and/or GMS resolutions.

In carrying out its primary duties, the Board of Directors, through Board of Directors meetings or a joint approval mechanism, has the authority to do the followings:

1. Proposing the vision, mission, and strategy of the Company;  
2. Establishing the basic policies of the Company's corporate, financial, organizational and HR strategies as well as information and communication technology systems;  
3. Submitting a proposal for the management of the Company which requires the approval of the Board of Commissioners and the approval of the GMS and executing it in accordance with the provisions stipulated in the Articles of Association, the approval of the Board of Commissioners, and the resolutions of the GMS;  
4. Striving to achieve the target indicators of financial aspect, operational aspect, and administrative aspect which are used as the basis for assessing the Company's soundness level in accordance with the performance determined by the Shareholders;  
5. Setting performance targets and evaluating the performance of the Company, directorates, operating units, and business units through the Company's organizational mechanisms as well as performance targets and evaluating the performance of Subsidiaries including strategic plans and dividend policies of Subsidiaries through the mechanism of subsidiary organs in accordance with the provisions applicable to Subsidiaries;  
6. Determining proposals and changes to RJPP and RKAP in accordance with the applicable regulations;  
7. Determining investment feasibility approval according to the authority of the Board of Directors, monitors and makes corrections to its implementation;  
8. Establishing cooperation activities or contracts with value and time or use/acquisition in accordance with the authority regulated in the Company regulations;  
9. Establishing financial policies that need to be periodically reviewed by the Board of Directors, such as cash management, expenditure authority, and payment authority;  
10. Determining the organizational structure and the appointment of the Company's officers to a certain level which is regulated through the Company's regulations.

Selain itu, Direksi Perseroan juga memiliki hak dan wewenang sebagai berikut.

1. Menetapkan kebijkanan yang dipandang tersebut dalam kepada pengusuran Perseroan.  
2. Mengatur penyerahan kekuasaan Direksi untuk mewakili Perseroan di dalam dan di luar pengadilan kepada seorang ata untuk menjadi orang yang khusus ditunjuk untuk itu termasuk pekerja Perseroan baik sendirisendiri maupun bersama-sama dan/atau badan lain.  
3. Mengatur ketentuan tentang pekerja Perseroan termasuk penetapan upah, pensiun ata jaminan hari tua, dan penghasilan lain bagi pekerja Perseroan berdasarkan peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku.  
4. Mengangkat dan memberhentikan karyawan Perseroan berdasarkan peraturan ketenagakerjaan Perseroan dan peraturan perdang-undangan.  
5. Mengangkat dan memberhentikan seorang Sekretaris Perusahaan dan/atau Kepala Satuan Pengawas Intern dengan persetujuan Dewan Komisaris.  
6. Menghapusbukukan piutang macet dengan ketentuan sebagai bagaimana diatur dalam Anggaran Dasar dan yang selanjutnya dilaporkan kepada Dewan Komisaris dan selanjutnya dilaporkan dan dipertanggung jawabkan dalam Laporan Tahunan.  
7. Tidak menagihLAGi piutang bunga, denda, ongkos-ongkos, dan piutang lainnya di luarPokok yang dilakukan dalamrangka restrukturasi dan/atau penyelesaian piutang serta perbuatan-perbuatan lain dalamrangka penyelesaian piutang Perseroan dengan kewajiban melaporkan kepada Dewan Komisaris yang ketentuan dan tata cara pelaporanya ditetapkan oleh Dewan Komisaris.

# Pembagian Tugas antara Direksi

Masing-masing anggota Direksi Perseroan memiliki tugas yang diatur lebih lanjut dalam peraturan Perusahaan, yang diuraikan sebagai berikut.

1. Direktur Utama-Sebagai President Director adalah Jenjang eksekutif tertinggi dalam perusahaan (eksekutif) yang diberi tanggung jawab untuk mengatur keseluruhan suatu organisasi, dengan ketentuan-Sebagai berikut.

Furthermore, the Board of Directors of the Company also has the following rights and authorities.

1. Establishing policies that are deemed appropriate in the management of the Company.  
2. Regulating the delegation of authorities of the Board of Directors to represent the Company inside and outside the court to one or several persons specifically appointed for that purpose, including the Company's employees, either individually or jointly and/or other entities.  
3. Regulating provisions regarding the Company's employees including the determination of wages, pensions or old-age benefits, and other income for the Company's employees based on the prevailing laws and regulations.  
4. Appointing and dismissing the Company's employees based on the Company's employment regulations and laws and regulations.  
5. Appointing and dismissing a Corporate Secretary and/or Head of Internal Supervisory Unit with the approval of the Board of Commissioners.  
6. Writing off bad debts with the provisions as stipulated in the Articles of Association, which is subsequently reported to the Board of Commissioners as well as reported and accounted for in the Annual Report.  
7. No longer collecting interest receivables, fines, fees, and other receivables aside from the principal carried out in the context of restructuring and/or settlement of receivables as well as other actions in the context of settling the Company's receivables with the obligation to report to the Board of Commissioners whose reporting provisions and procedures are stipulated by the Board of Commissioners.  
8. Performing all other actions and deeds regarding the management and ownership of the Company's assets, binding the Company with other parties and/or other parties with the Company, and representing the Company inside and outside the court regarding all matters and all events, with the limitations as stipulated in the laws and regulations, the Articles of Association, and/or the GMS resolutions.

# Board of Directors' Division of Duties

Each member of the Company's Board of Directors has specific duties as further regulated in the Company's regulations, which are outlined as follows.

1. President Director as President Director (CEO) is the highest level in the Company (executive) who is given the responsibility to manage the entire organization, with the following provisions.

a. Direktur Utama bertugas-Sebagai seorang komunikator, pengambil keputusan, pemimpin, pengelola (manager), dan eksekutor. Peran komunikator melibatkan pers dan pihak eksternal serta manajemen dan kanyakan Perseroan. Peran pengambil keputusan mencakup keputusan tingkat tinggi terkait kebikan dan strategi.  
b. Sebagai pemimpin, Direktur Utama memberi saran kepada anggota Direksi lainnya, memotivasi karyawan, dan menggerakkan perubahan dalam organisasi.  
c. Dalam menjalankan tugas tersebut, Direktur Utama dibantu oleh 4 Direktur, yaitu Direktur Bisnis, Direktur Operasi dan Pembangunan, Direktur Keuangan dan Manajemen Risiko, dan Direktur Investasi.

2. Direktur Keuangan dan Manajemen Risiko sebagai Director Finance and Risk Management memimpin direktorat yang berfokus pada pengelolaan manajemen akuntansi, treasury & tax, supply chain management, dan manajemen sumber daya manusia.  
3. Direktur Operasi dan Pembangunan sebagai Director of Operations and Development memimpin direktorat yang berfokus pada pengelolaan pembangunan dan manajemen proyek, manajemen asset, operasi, information and technology, dan area.  
4. Direktur Bisnis-Sebagai Director of Business memimpin direktorat yang berfokus pada pengelolaan sales dan marketing and innovation.  
5. Direktur Investasi sebagai Director of Investment memimpin direktorat yang berfokus pada pengelolaan manajemen investasi, hubungan dengan investor, corporate finance dan kepadauhan atas kewajiban pelaporan sebagai perusahaan terbuka.

# Rapat Direksi

Berdasarkan Board Manual yang berlaku, penyelenggaraanRAPAT internal wajib dilakukan oleh Direksi setidaknya 1 kalidalam setup bulan, sedangkan, rapat gabungan dengan Dewan Komisaris wajib dilaksanan paling sedikit 1 kalisi tetap 3 bulan. Hasil rapat wajib dituangkan dalam risalahRAPAT dan risalah rapat wajib didokumentasikan olehPerseroan. Informasi tingkat kehadiran Direksi dalam rapatselama tahun 2024 ditunjukkan sebagai berikut.

a. The President Director serves as a communicator, decision maker, leader, manager, and executor. The communicator's role involves the press and external parties, as well as management and employees of the Company; decision-making roles include high-level decisions related to policies and strategies.  
b. As a leader, the President Director provides advice to other members of the Board of Directors, motivates the employees, and drives changes in the organization.  
c. In carrying out these duties, the President Director is assisted by 4 Directors, namely the Director of Business, Director of Operations and Development, Director of Finance and Risk Management, and Director of Investment.

2. Director of Finance and Risk Management as Director of Finance and Risk Management leads the directorate which focuses on accounting management, treasury & tax, supply chain management and human resources management.  
3. Director of Operations and Development as Director of Operations and Development leads the directorate which focuses on development & project management, asset management, operations, information & technology, and area.  
4. Director of Business as Director of Business (CCO) leads the directorate which focuses on sales and marketing and innovation.  
5. Director of Investment Director as Director of Investment leads the directorate which focuses on managing investment management, investor relations, corporate finance and compliance with reporting obligations as a public company.

# Pelaksanaan Tugas Direksi

Sepanjang tahun 2024, Direksi Perseroan telah melaksanan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya, di antaranya:

1. Menyelenggaraman RUPS Tahunan pada tahun 2024 yang diselenggaraman pada 31 Mei 2024;  
2. Menerapkan GCG dalam setiap kegiatan usaha Perseroan;  
3. Melaksanakan tugas terkait pengurusan Perseroan;  
4. Menyusun RJPP 2025-2029;  
5. Menyusun RKAP 2025;  
6. Menyelenggaramakan rapat Direksi sebanyak 38 kaligi selama tahun 2024;  
7. Menghadiri rapat Dewan Komisaris;  
8. Menyelenggaran earnings call seabanyak 4 kali sepanjang tahun 2024 untuk memaparkan kinerja Perseroan setiapkuartak kepada publik, yaitu tahun buku 2023 pada 13 Maret 2024, triwulan 1 2024 pada 24 April 2024, semester 1 2024 pada 30 Juli 2024, dan 9 bulan pertama 2024 pada 30 Oktober 2024;  
9. Menyalurkan dana Tanggung Jawab Sosial dan Lingkungan (TJSL) menjadi pentuk komitmen Perseroan dalam memberdayakan masyarakat dan mencatkan kesejahteraan lingkungan; dan  
10. Menerapkan GCG pada proses inorganik melalui dokumen Keputusan Dewan Komisaris (Sirkuler) PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk tersebut Persetujuan Pelaksanaan Penyelesaian Transaksi Project Eureka (Ultra) No. 069/DEKOM-DMT/11/2024 tertanggal 28 November 2024.

# Pengembangan Kompetensi Direksi

# Kebijakan Pengembangan Kompetensi Direksi

Perseroan nutzen programPEGK Kompetsi   
tuk mendukung efektivitas kerja Direksi. Perencanaan   
kebutuhanPEGK Kompetensi Direksi dilakukan   
leh Sekretaris Perusahaan dan dimasukkan ke dalam   
RKAP, dengan mempertimbangkan masukan dari Dewan   
Komisaris.

Direksi yang mencikuti programseperti seminar ata pelatihan diwajibkan mencampaikan presentasi kepada anggota Direksi lain yang tidak berpartisipasi guna mendorong pertukaran informasi dan pengetahuan. Selain itu, Direksi yang mencikuti peningkatan kompetensi bertanggung jawab menyusun laporan pelaksanaan program yang kemudian disampaikan kepada Direktur Utama.Pada tahun 2024,programpeningkatan kompetensi yang diikuti oleh Direksi sebagai berikut.

# Implementation of the Board of Directors' Duties

Throughout 2024, the Company's Board of Directors carried out its duties and responsibilities, among others:

1. Holding the 2024 Annual GMS on May 31, 2024;  
2. Implementing GCG in all of the Company's business activities;  
3. Carrying out out duties related to the management of the Company;  
4. Preparing the Long-Term Corporate Plan (RJPP) for 2025-2029;  
5. Preparing the Corporate Budget and Work Plan (RKAP) for 2025;  
6. Conducting 38 Board of Directors' meetings throughout 2024;  
7. Attending Board of Commissioners' meetings;  
8. Holding 4 earnings calls throughout 2024 to present the Company's quarterly performance to the public, covering the fiscal year 2023 on March 13, 2024, Q12024 on April 24, 2024, the first semester of 2024 on July 30, 2024, and the first 9 months of 2024 on October 30, 2024;  
9. Disbursing Corporate Social and Environmental Responsibility (TJSL) funds as part of the Company's commitment to empowering communities and improving environmental welfare; and  
10. Implementing GCG in the inorganic process through the Board of Commissioners' Circular Decision of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk on the Approval for the Execution of Project Eureka (Ultra) Transaction Settlement No. 069/DEKOM-DMT/11/2024, dated November 28, 2024.

# Competency Development of Board of Directors

# Competency Development Policy for the Board of Directors

The Company implements competency development programs to support the effectiveness of the Board of Directors' performance. The planning for competency development needs is carried out by the Corporate Secretary and included in the Corporate Budget and Work Plan (RKAP), by considering input from the Board of Commissioners.

Directors who participate in programs such as seminars or training are required to present their insights to other Directors who did not attend, aiming to foster information and knowledge exchange. Additionally, Directors who undergo competency development are responsible for preparing a program implementation report, which is then submitted to the President Director. # Program Orientasi/Pengenalan bagi Anggota Direksi Baru

Anggota Direksi yangbaru diangkat akan mengikuti program pengenalan untuk memahami kondisi umum Perseroan. Program ini bertujuan memberikan wawasan menyeluruh terkait bisnis, operasional, dan tata kelola perusahaan. Pelaksanaan program pengenalan menjadi tanggung jawab Sekretaris Perusahaan atas pihak lain yang menjalankan fungsi tersebut.

Materi yang disampaikan dalam program pengenalan bagi Direksi yangbaru diangkat, antara lain:

1. Pengenalan mengenai Perseroan termasuk visi, misi, strategi, kinerja, kondisi keuangan, risiko dan perkembangan terkini Perseroan;  
2. Pemahaman ingin industri telekomunikasi, termasuk pengetahunan ingin Produk-produk Perseroan;  
3. Pemahaman terhadap regulasi dan kebijakan pemerintah, khususnya terhadap industri telekomunikasi;  
4. Pemahaman terhadap aspek financial (financial literacy), khususnya terkait pemeriksaan Laporan Keuangan, termasuk namun tidak terbatas pada neraca keuangan, laporan laba rugi, laporan arus kas, dan laporan perubahan ekuitas, serta catatan atas laporan keuangan perusahaan terbuka;

# Orientation/Introduction Program for New Members of the Board of Directors

Newly appointed members of the Board of Directors will undergo an orientation program to familiarize themselves with the general condition of the Company. This program aims to provide comprehensive insights into the Company's business, operations, and corporate governance. The implementation of the orientation program is the responsibility of the Corporate Secretary or another designated party performing this function.

The topics covered in the orientation program for newly appointed Directors include:

1. Introduction of the Company including its vision, mission, strategy, performance, financial condition, risks, and the latest developments of the Company;  
2. Understanding of the telecommunications industry, including the Company's products knowledge;  
3. Understanding of government regulations and policies, especially related to the telecommunications industry;  
4. Understanding of financial aspects (financial literacy), particularly related to the examination of financial statements, including but not limited to the financial balance sheet, profit and loss statement, cash flow statement, and statement of changes in equity, as well as notes to the financial statements of public companies;

5. Pelaksanaan prinsip-prinsip GCG di Perseroan, governance, risk and compliance, dan whistleblowing system, termasuk etika dan norma yang berlaku di lingkungan Perseroan;  
6. Peran, tugas, dan tanggung jawab Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi, termasuk Internal Audit dan Komite;  
7. Perkenalan dengan jajaran manajemen dan kunjungan ke masing-masing unit Perseroan; dan  
8. Team building yang menyertakan tersebut anggota Direksi, baik yangbaru menjabat maupun yang pernah menjabat sebelumnya dengan tujuan mewujudkan kekompakan dan kerja sama tim sebagai Direksi.

Penyusunan materi program pengenalan terlebih dahulu memperhatikan arahan Direksi dan mempertimbangkan nasihat Dewan Komisaris. Paling lambat 3 bulan setelah program pengenalan dilakukan, Sekretaris Perusahaan ataupun pihak yang menjalankan fungsi Sekretaris Perusahaan wajib melakukan evaluasi terhadappelaksanaan program pengenalan tersebut. Pada tahun 2024, Perseroan tidak melaksanan program pengenalan bagi Direksi karena tidak ada anggotabaru yang diangkat.

# Penilaian Kinerja Direksi

# Penilaian Kinerja Direksi Berdasarkan KPI

1. Kebijakan, Prosedur, Pelaksanaan, dan Pihak yang Melakukan Penilaian Kinerja

Secara berkala setidaknya 4 kali dalam setahun, dilakukan penilaian terhadap kinerja Direksi berdasarkan KPI. Penyusunan KPI untuk Perseroan secara keseluruhan maupun untuk masing-masing anggota Direksi dilakukan oleh Direksi. Selanjutnya, usulan KPI ini diajukan kepada Dewan Komisaris untuk mendapatkan persetujuan.

Dalam menususun KPI, Direksi wajib memperhatikan dan mempertimbangkan berbagai parameter penilaian, termasuk:

a. Penerapan GCG;  
b. Aspirasi Pemegang Saham;  
c. Penetapan absolute target untuk RKAP dan KPI; dan  
d. Ketentuan perundang-undangan.

Setelah KPI disusun, Direksi menandatangani Kontrak Manajemen yang memuat KPI tersebut dan melaporkanya kepada Dewan Komisaris.

5. Implementation of GCG principles within the Company, governance, risk, and compliance, and the whistleblowing system, including ethics and norms applicable within the Company's environment;  
6. The roles, duties, and responsibilities of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors, including the Internal Audit and the Committees;  
7. Introduction to the management and visits to each unit of the Company; and  
8. Team Building involving all members of the Board of Directors, both newly appointed and previously serving members, with the aim of fostering cohesion and teamwork within the Board of Directors.

The preparation of the orientation program materials considers the directives of the Board of Directors and considers the advice of the Board of Commissioners. No later than 3 months after the orientation program is conducted, the Corporate Secretary or the party performing the Corporate Secretary function must evaluate the implementation of the program. In 2024, the Company did not conduct an orientation program for the Board of Directors, as no new members were appointed.

# Performance Assessment of the Board of Directors

# Performance Assessment of the Board of Directors Based on Key Performance Indicators

1. Policy, Procedure, Implementation, and Evaluating Parties

Periodically, at least 4 times a year, an assessment of the Board of Directors' performance is conducted based on KPI. The formulation of KPI for the Company as a whole, as well as for each member of the Board of Directors, is carried out by the Board of Directors. Subsequently, this proposed KPI is submitted to the Board of Commissioners for approval.

In formulating the KPI, the Board of Directors must consider and consider various assessment parameters, including:

a. Implementation of GCG;  
b. Shareholders' aspirations;  
c. Establishment of absolute targets for RKAP and KPI; and  
d. Applicable laws and regulations.

Once the KPI is formulated, the Board of Directors signs a Management Contract that includes the KPI and reports it to the Board of Commissioners.

Evaluasi kinerja Direksi, baik secara kolektif maupun individu, dilakukan oleh pengelola Kontrak Manajemen Telkom Group yang selanjutnya dilaporkan kepada Dewan Komisaris. Penilaian ini didasarkan pada pelaksanaan tugas, kewajiban, dan tanggung jawab yang telah ditetapkan dalam ketentuan perundangundanganserta Anggaran Dasar Perseroan.

# 2. Kriteria Penilaian

Kriteria evaluasi kinerja Direksi ditetapkan dalam RUPS berdasarkan KPI. Kriteria evaluasi kinerja Direksi setidaknya sebagai berikut.

a. Penyusunan KPI dan evaluasi pencapaiannya.  
b. Tingkat kehadiran Direksi dalam rapat Direksi maupun rapat Dewan Komisaris.  
c. Kontribusi dalam aktivitas bisnis Perseroan.  
d. Keterlibatandalampenugasan-penugasantertentu.  
e. Komitmen Direksi dalam memajukan kepentingan Perseroan.  
f. Ketaatan terhadap peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlakuserta kebjikan Perseroan.  
g. Pencapaian target Perseroan yang tertuang dalam RKAP dan Kontrak Manajemen.

# 3. Hasil Penilaian

Pada tahun 2024, tersebut penilaian kinerja Direksi berdasarkan Kontrak Manajemen yang mengacu pada target RKAP menunjukkan bahwa Direksi berhasil melampai target yang telah ditetapkan.

# Penilaian Kinerja Direksi Berdasarkan Self-Assessment

Berdasarkan Peraturan Bersama Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. 060/DEKOM-DMT/10/2024 dan No. PD. 0009/ HK 200/DMT-11120000/2024tentang Panduan Tata Kerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi (Board Manual) PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk pada tanggal 30 Oktober 2024, terdapat kebikan untuk penilaian sendiri (self-assessment) yang diungkapkan pada Laporan Tahunan. Kebikan ini dirancang untuk memastikan akuntabilitas dan mendukung upaya pengingga kinerja Direksi secara berkesinambungan.

# 2. Kriteria Penilaian

Penilaian kinerja (self-assessment) dilakukan oleh masing-masing anggota Direksi untuk mencevausi kinerja Direksi secara kolegial. Kebijakan ini tidak bertujuan untuk mereka kinerja individu, melainkan berfokus pada pencapaian kolektif Direksi sebagai tahun kesatuan. Melalui pendekatan ini, setup anggota Direksi diharapkan berkontribusi dalam mencidentifikasi area perbaikan serta mencatkan efektivitas dan kinerja

The performance evaluation of the Board of Directors, both collectively and individually, is carried out by Telkom Group Management Contract administrator and subsequently reported to the Board of Commissioners. This assessment is based on the implementation of duties, obligations, and responsibilities as stipulated in the applicable laws and regulations as well as the Company's Articles of Association.

# 2. Assessment Criteria

The criteria for evaluating the performance of the Board of Directors are determined in the GMS based on KPI. The performance evaluation criteria for the Board of Directors include at least the following.

a. Formulation of KPI and evaluation of its achievement.  
b. Attendance of the Board of Directors in Board of Directors' meetings and Board of Commissioners' meetings.  
c. Contribution to the Company's business activities.  
d. Involvement in specific assignments.  
e. Commitment of the Board of Directors to advancing the Company's interests.  
f. Compliance with applicable laws and regulations as well as the Company's policies.  
g. Achievement of the Company's targets as stipulated in the RKAP and Management Contract.

# 3. Assessment Results

In 2024, the performance evaluation results of the Board of Directors, based on the Management Contract referring to the RKAP targets, indicate that the Board of Directors successfully exceeded the established targets.

# Performance Assessment of the Organs Under the Board of Directors

Each year, the Board of Directors evaluates the performance of the Corporate Secretary, and the Internal Audit Unit based on established criteria. For the Internal Audit Unit, a Management Contract is signed by the President Director as a derivative of the President Director's Management Contract. Additionally, the Internal Audit Unit has specific KPIs aligned with its work program and predetermined performance indicators, ensuring that its duties are carried out in a structured and measurable manner.

Based on the performance evaluation procedures and criteria in 2024, the Corporate Secretary was assessed as having played an active role in monitoring developments and ensuring compliance with capital market regulations, as well as providing input to the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners to meet these regulatory requirements. Similarly, the Internal Audit Unit was recognized for assisting the Board of Directors by providing recommendations on operational and financial audit work programs, implementing internal controls, risk management, and applying GCG across all aspects of the Company's operations.

# Information about Committees Under the Board of Directors

As of 2024, the Company do not establish any committees under the Board of Directors. Therefore, there is no information available regarding the execution of duties or the performance evaluation of such committees. Nevertheless, the Board of Directors is supported by units/departments under its supervision, with their performance evaluations conducted collectively by all members of the Board of Directors.
