# Prosedur Audit Eksternal dan Standar Audit

Audit Laporan Keuangan Perseroandilakukan sesuai dengan standar profesional akuntan publik, mencakup pengujian, pemeriksaan, evaluasi laporan keuangan, dan memastikan kesesuaianya dengan standar akuntansi keuangan. Dalam prosesnya, kantor akuntan publik mengadakan sesi diskusi dengan manajemen untuk mengklarifikasipernyataan dalam Laporan Keuangan. Jika ditemukan ketidaksesuaian, kantor akuntan publik wajib melaporkanya kepada manajemen untuk ditindaklanjuti. Manajemen bertanggung jawab memberikan persetujuan atas kertas kerja kantor akuntan publik, yang dapat digunakan untuk pengkajian lebih lanjut oleh otoritas terkait.

# Mekanisme Penunjukan Akuntan Publik

Penunjukan kantor akuntan publik sebagai auditor eksternal dilakukan melalui mekanisme RUPS Tahunan. Proses penunjukan kantor akuntan publik diawali dengan rekomendasi dari Komite Audit, yang mempertimbangkan pendapat Dewan Komisaris sebelum disampaikan kepada para Pemegang Saham untuk disetujui. Kantor akuntan publik yang ditunjuk bertugas secara independen untuk mencaudit Laporan Keuangan Tahunan Perseroan dan memberikan opini profesional atas kesesuaian penyajian laporan tersebut dengan standar akuntansi keuanganyang berlaku di Indonesia.

Untuk memastikan objektivitas dan kualitas audit, Perseroan memilih kantor akuntan publik dan akuntan publik yang tidak memiliki potensi benturan kepentingan dengan manajemen ataupejabat di berbagai level organisasi. Dengan demikian, integritas haben pemeriksaan dapat dijaga, sekalisus memastikan Laporan Keuangan mencerminkan kondisi keuangan perusahaan secara transparan dan akuntabel.

Financial Accounting Standards serve as guidelines for preparing Financial Statements, in addition to the Decree of the Chairman of Capital Market and Financial Institution Supervisory Agency No. KEP-347/BL/2012 on the Guidelines for the Presentation and Disclosure of Financial Statements of Issuers or Public Companies.

# External Audit Procedures and Audit Standards

The audit of the Company's Financial Statements is conducted in accordance with professional public accounting standards, encompassing testing, examination, financial statements evaluation, and ensuring compliance with financial accounting standards. During the process, the public accounting firm holds discussion sessions with management to clarify statements in the Financial Statements. If any discrepancies are found, the public accounting firm must report them to management for follow-up actions. Management is responsible for approving the public accounting firm's working papers, which may be subject to further review by relevant authorities.

# Mechanism for Appointing a Public Accountant

The appointment of a public accounting firm as an external auditor is carried out through the Annual GMS. The selection process begins with a recommendation from the Audit Committee, which considers input from the Board of Commissioners before presenting it to Shareholders for approval. The appointed public accounting firm operates independently to audit the Company's Annual Financial Statements and provide a professional opinion on the conformity of their presentation with the applicable financial accounting standards in Indonesia.

To ensure objectivity and audit quality, the Company selects public accounting firms and public accountants who do not have potential conflicts of interest with management or officials at various levels of the organization. This approach safeguards the integrity of the audit results while ensuring that the Financial Statements transparently and accountably reflect the Company's financial condition.

# - Sistem Pengendalian Internal

Internal Control System

Sistem pengendalian internal adalah proses berkelanjutan yang melibatkan manajemen dan seluruh karyawan Perseroan untuk memastikan pengelolaan yang sesuai dengan kebikan, mendukung pencapaian tujuan,{serta memitigasi risiko bisnis signifikan. Sistem ini juga berfungsi mencegah penyimpangan kebikan strategis dan operasional serta memastikan kepadahan terhadap hukum dan peraturan yang berlaku.

Kerangka pengendalian internal di Perseroan meliputi:

1. Lingkungan pengendalian internal yang disiplin dan terstruktur, terdiri dari:

a. Integritas, nilai etika, dan kompetensi karyawan merupakan cara yang ditempuh manajemen dalam melaksanakan kewenangan dan tanggung jawabnya;  
b. Pengorganisasian dan pengembangan sumber daya manusia; dan  
c. Perhatian dan arahan yang dilakukan oleh Direksi;

The internal control system is a continuous process involving management and all employees to ensure that operations align with company policies, support the achievement of objectives, and mitigate significant business risks. This system also serves to prevent deviations from strategic and operational policies while ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

The Company's internal control framework consists of:

1. A disciplined and structured internal control environment, which includes:

a. Integrity, ethical values, and employee competence, serving as the foundation for management in executing its authority and responsibilities;  
b. Organization and human resource development; and  
c. Guidance and direction provided by the Board of Directors;

2. Pengkajian dan pengelolaan risiko usaha yaitu suatu proses untuk mengidentifikasi, menganalisis, menjadi dan mengelola risiko usaha;  
3. Aktivitas pengendalian, yaitu tindakan-tindakan yang dilakukan dalam suatu proses pengendalian terhadap kegiatan Perseroan pada setiap tingkat dan unit dalam struktur organisi Perseroan, antara lain mengenai kewenangan, otorisasi, verifikasi, rekonsiliasi, penilawan atas prestasi kerja, pembagian tugas dan keamanan terhadap aset Perseroan;  
4. Sistem informasi dan komunikasi, yaitu suatu proses penyajian laporan mengenai kegiatan operasional, fnansial, dan ketaatan atas ketentuan dan peraturan yang berlaku pada Perseroan; dan  
5. Monitoring, yaitu proses penilaian terhadap kualitas systemd pengendalian internal, termasuk fungsi internal audit pada setiap tingkat dan unit struktur organisasi Perseroan, Seeingga dapat dilaksanakan secara optimal.

# Pengendalian Keuangan dan Operasional

Perseroan menerapkan systemd pengendalian keuangan yang mencakup perencanaan, umpan balik, penyesuanian, hingga validasi untuk memastikan rencana keuangan terlaksana dengan baik kepada diperbarui sesuai kebutuhan akibat perubahan yang terjadi. Sementara itu, pengendalian operasional difokuskan pada penataan proses agar kegiatan operasional dapat berjalan secara efektif dan efisien.

Secara umum, pengendalian operational dan keuangan di Mitratel, meliputi:

1. Pengendalian Aset Tetap dan Aset Tak Berwujud Pengendalian fisik aset di lingkungan Perseroan diarahkan untuk mengamikan dan melindungi aset-aset berisiko.  
2. Pemisah Fungsi dan Otoritas
Pemisahan fungsi diarahkan untuk memastikan adanya pengawasan yang memadai dan mengurangi potensi kesalahan dan kecurangan.  
3. Pelaksanaan Kejadian dan Transaksi Pengendalian dilakukan untuk memastikan aktivitas transaksi dilakukan semestinya sesuai perencanaan dan kebutuhan yang telah ditetapkan.

2. Business risk assessment and management, a process for identifying, analyzing, evaluating, and managing business risks;  
3. Control activities, which are actions carried out as part of the control process over the Company's activities at every level and unit within the Company's organizational structure, including authority, authorization, verification, reconciliation, performance assessment, task segregation, and safeguarding of the Company's assets;  
4. Information and communication systems, which ensure the proper reporting of operational, financial, and compliance-related activities in accordance with applicable regulations; and

# Financial and Operational Controls

The Company implements a financial control system that encompasses planning, feedback, adjustments, and validation to ensure that financial plans are properly executed or updated as needed due to changing circumstances. Meanwhile, operational control focuses on structuring processes to ensure that operational activities run effectively and efficiently.

In general, operational, and financial controls at Mitratel include:

1. Control of Fixed Assets and Intangible Assets The physical control of assets within the Company focuses on securing and protecting assets at risk.  
2. Separation of Functions and Authority
Separation of functions is geared towards adequate review and reducing the potential for error and fraud.  
3. Implementation of Events and Transactions Controls are implemented to ensure that transaction activities are carried out in accordance with predetermined plans and requirements.  
4. Accurate and Timely Recording of Events and Transactions Accurate and timely recording of operational events and transactions carried out.  
5. Access Restrictions and Accountability for Resources and Records Access to company resources and records should be restricted to personnel with specific duties and responsibilities.

6. Dokumentasi yang Baik atas Kejadian dan Transaksi Pengendalian

Setiap kejadian dan transaksi dalam Perseroan didokumentasikan dengan baik sebagai bukti dasar keterjadian dan pewajaran transaksi.

# Review of Internal Control's Effectiveness

Mitratel consistently reviews the effectiveness of its internal control system to ensure optimal implementation across all organizational levels. This process involves several parties with the following responsibilities.

1. Management

Management is responsible for ensuring that a reliable and effective internal control system is comprehensively implemented in accordance with the Company's policies.

2. Internal Audit Department and External Audit

The Internal Audit Department and External Audit are responsible for monitoring the implementation of the internal control system and reporting their findings to the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners through the Audit Committee. Any audit findings identified are reported to the relevant management for follow-up as corrective actions.

3. Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners

The Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners, through the Audit Committee, periodically hold meetings with the Internal Audit Department and External Audit. These meetings aim to:

a. Discuss the results of internal control system monitoring;  
b. Evaluate issues requiring attention; and  
c. Develop follow-up plans to enhance the effectiveness of the internal control system.

# Statement of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors on the Implementation of Internal Control System

Based on the 2024 assessment, the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors of the Company assess that the existing internal control system meets the required standards to ensure effectiveness, efficiency, reliability, security, and compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Furthermore, no material weaknesses were found in the internal control system across business units, as all operational findings and deviations have been properly addressed and resolved.

# - Sistem Manajemen Risiko

Risk Management System

Dalam menjalankan aktivitas usaha, PerseroanPTHiapa berbagai risiko internal dan eksternal yang berpotensi menghambat pencapaian tujuan. Untuk mengelola risiko tersebut, Perseroan menerapkan proses manajemen risiko secara menyeluruh, meliputi identifikasi, penilaian tingkat risiko, penyusunan program mitigasi, serta monitoring dan pengendalian secara berkelanjutan.

# Kebijakan Manajemen Risiko

Manajemen risiko Perseroan didasarkan pada 2 kebijakan utama, yaitu:

1. Peraturan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.002/HK 200/JDMT-1063000/2021 ingin Pengelolaan Risiko Perusahaan Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Mitratel Group, yang ditetapkan pada tanggal17 Desember 2021; dan  
2. Peraturan Direktur Keuangan dan Manajemen Risiko PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.001/ HK 200/JDMT-1074000/2022 tantalang Pedoman Implementasi Manajemen Risiko Perusahaan (Enterprise Risk Management) Mitratel Group, yang ditetapkan pada 23 September 2022.

Selain itu, standardisasi manajemen risiko Perseroan mengacu pada ISO 31000:2018 Risk Management - Principles and Guidelines, yang mencakup 3 komponen utama, yaitu:

1. Prinsip bestehtagi fondasi bagaimana manajemen risikoberjalan untuk menjamin tercipta dan terlindunginyanilai;  
2. Kerangka kerja yang mengatur komitmen atas peran dan pembagian fungsi manajemen risiko;  
3. Proses yang menjelaskan aktivitas/tahapan dalam melakukan manajemen risiko. Proses manajemen risiko terdiri dari 6 proses yaitu:

a. Penetapan konteks, mulai dari lingkup, konteks, dan kriteria;  
b. Risk assessment yang terdiri dari:

- Risk identification;  
- Risk analysis; dan  
- Risk evaluation;

c. Risk treatment;  
d. Komunikasi dan konsultasi;  
e. Monitoring dan review; dan  
f. Pencatatan dan pelaporan.

In conducting its business activities, the Company faces various internal and external risks that could potentially hinder the achievement of its objectives. To manage these risks, the Company implements a comprehensive risk management process, which includes risk identification, risk assessment, mitigation program development, and continuous monitoring and control.

# Risk Management Policy

The Company's risk management is based on 2 key policies:

1. Board of Directors Regulation of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.002/HK 200/JDMT-1063000/2021 on Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) of Mitratel Group, established on December 17, 2021; and  
2. Regulation of Director of Finance and Risk Management of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.001/ HK 200/JDMT-1074000/2022 on Guidelines for the Implementation of Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) of Mitratel Group, established on September 23, 2022.

Furthermore, the Company's risk management standardization refers to ISO 31000:2018 Risk Management - Principles and Guidelines, which consists of 3 main components:

1. Principles as the foundation for how risk management operates to ensure the creation and protection of value;  
2. Framework that defines commitments regarding roles and responsibilities in risk management;  
3. Process that outlines the activities/stages of risk management. Risk management process consists of 6 steps:

a. Context establishment, covering scope, context, and criteria;  
b. Risk assessment, which includes:

- Risk identification;  
Risk analysis; and  
- Risk evaluation;

c. Risk treatment;  
d. Communication and consultation;  
e. Monitoring and review; and  
f. Recording and reporting.

Dalam kerangka enterprise risk management, manajemen risiko++, bagian integral hari operasional setiap unit kerja. Proses ini melibatkan seluruh lapisan organisasi, termasuk manajemen dan karyawan, untuk secara proaktif mengidentifikasi kejadian ata potensi kejadian yang dapat menimbulkan kerugian serta mengelolanya secara menyeluruh.

Untuk memastikan manajemen risiko terintegrasi secara menyeluruh ke dalam proses bisnis dan operasional Perseroan, telah dilakukan sejumlah langkah strategis, di antaranya:

1. Melakukan pembaruan kebijakan/prosedur/manual;  
2. Mengembangkan(APlikasi system informasi manajemen risiko yang terintegrasi;  
3. Meningkatkan kualitas dan konsistensi risk profile dan risk register; dan  
4. Meningkatkan kapabilitas, awareness, dan culture terkait manajemen risiko di Perseroan.

Sebagai bagian dari rencana strategistis Telkom Group, khususnya dalam penguatan fungsi manajemen risiko, peningkatan budaya kesadaran risiko (risk awareness culture)unjedi elemen penting untuk mendukung pencapaian target dan tujuan Perseroan.

Risk awareness culture yang baik memberikan berbagai manfaat, antara lain:

3. Mendukung tercapainya target kinerja Perseroan.

# Pelaksanaan Kegiatan  
Departemen Manajemen Risiko

Pada tahun 2024, Departemen Manajemen Risiko telah melaksanan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya dalam mengelola berbagai risiko di Perseroan, meliputi:

1. Melakukan tinjauan dan finalisasi risk factor untuk RJPP 2023-2027;  
2. Melakukan tinjauan dan finalisi profil risiko 2024;  
3. Membuat Laporan Manajemen kepada Direksi dan Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko;  
4. Melakukan pembaruan kebijakan/prosedur/manual;  
5. Melakukan review risiko atas justifikasi bisnis, justifikasi anggaran, proses operasional, dan kelayakan program;  
6. Melakukan checklist review terkait kesesuaian approval, kelayakan program, sinergi dengan program utama, dan kelengkapan analisis risiko;  
7. Melaksanakan sosialisasi sehubungan dengan terbitnya Peraturan Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara No. PER-2/MBU/03/2023 Tahun 2023 tersebut Pedoman Tata Kelola dan Kegiatan Korporasi Signifikan Badan Usaha Milik Negara;  
8. Menghadiri rapat berkala dengan Direksi dan seluruh Senior Leader di tiap unit;  
9. Memberi dukungan kepada Tim Revenue Assurance dan Budget Review Capital Expenditure dalam upaya pencegahan potensi risiko dan isu-isu manajemen risiko;  
10. Monitoring dan evaluasi atas efektivitas mitigasi risiko melalui aplikasi Enterprise Risk Management Online (ERM Online) yang digunakan oleh seluruh unit untuk pengelolaan risk register;  
11. Mengevaluasi/diskusi dan memberikan:nasihat secara one-on-one dengan pemilik risiko seksu kebutuhan;  
12. Melakukan pemantauan dan penilaian pengelolaan risiko di unit bisnis;  
13. Mengelola, melaksanakan, dan melaporkan rencana kerja(roadmap)ERM;

# Implementation of Risk Management Department's Activities

In 2024, the Risk Management Department carried out its duties and responsibilities in managing various risks in the Company, including:

1. Reviewing and finalizing risk factors for RJPP 2023-2027;  
2. Reviewing and finalizing the 2024 risk profile;  
3. Preparing Management Reports to the Board of Directors and Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring;  
4. Updating policies/procedures/manuals;  
5. Conducting risk reviews on business justification, budget justification, operational processes, and program feasibility;  
6. Conducting checklist reviews related to approval suitability, program feasibility, synergy with main programs, and completeness of risk analysis;

8. Attending periodic meetings with the Board of Directors and all Senior Leaders in each unit;

10. Monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of risk mitigation through the Enterprise Risk Management Online (ERM Online) application used by all units for risk register management;  
11. Evaluating/discussing and providing one-on-one advice with risk owners as needed;

13. Managing, implementing, and reporting on the ERM roadmap;

14. Melaksanakan pelatihan dan sertifikasi di bidang manajemen risiko;  
15. Melaksanakan program risk culture dan awareness; dan  
16. Melaksanakan audit internal pelaksanaan manajemen risiko.

# Risiko yang Dihadapi: Mengingat ekspektasi jangka panjang terkait pendapatan usaha dari penyewa, Perseroan terpapar risiko terkait kelayakan kredit dan kekuatan keuangan para penyewa Perseroan.

# Risiko yang Dihadapi: Teknologibaru yang telah dirancang untuk mencating katkan efisiensi jaringan nirkabel dan potensi active sharing spektrum nirkabel dapat mengurangi kebutuhan akan layanan nirkabel menara telekomunikasi.

# Dampak Impact

Pengenalan tekologibaru yang bertujuan untuk mencatingkatkanefektivitasjaringannirkabel,sepertipembagian spektrum aktif dan kemujuan speerti antenna multiband dan Massive Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (mMIMO),dupat mengurangi permintaan akan ruang menara.Selainitu,adopsi potensial dari pengaturan pembagian aktif antara operator jaringan seluler (MNO) jugada曹操 lebih lanjut mengurangi kebutuhan akan ruang menara, yang曹操 mengakibatkan penurunan bisnis, kondisi keuangan, dan kinerja operasional Perseroan.Selainitu,munculnya tekologi alternatif,seperti layanan satelit siaran langsung untuk komunikasi nirkabel,juga曹操 mengurangi permintaan akan layanan transmis di penerimaan berbasis menara, Seeingga memengaruhi bisnis, kondisi keuangan, dan kinerja operasional Perseroan.

The introduction of new technologies aimed at improving the effectiveness of wireless networks, such as active spectrum sharing and advances such as multiband antennas and Massive Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (mMIMO), may reduce the demand for tower space. Risk to be Faced: Changes in the domestic, regional and global economy could have a material adverse impact on the Indonesian economy and the Company's business activities.

# Risiko yang Dihadapi: Menara telekomunikasi Perseroan mungkin mengalami dampak bencana Alam untuk kerusakan yang tidak diperkurakan sebelumnya termasuk dampak dari perubahan iklim dan asuransi Perseroan yang mungkin tidak menyediakan perilindungan yang memadai.

Risk to be Faced: The Company's telecommunication towers may be impacted by natural disasters or unforeseen damage including the impact of climate change and the Company's insurance may not provide adequate coverage.

<table><tr><td>Dampak Impact</td><td>Terjadi kerusakan kepada kehancuran menara telekomunikasi akibat bencana Alam speerti badai, banjr, putting beliung, dan gempabumi, sama akibat perubahaniklim dapat memengaruh layanan kepada pelanggan. Kecukupan asuransi gangguan yang dimilikibelum memadai untuk mencutup seluruh pendapatan yang hilang, termasuk potensi pendapatan dari penyewaBARU yang semestinya dalam ditambahkan ke menara telekomunikasi seandainya kerusakan tersebut tidak terjadi. Hal ini dalammenimbulkan hilangnya pelanggan dan berdampak merugikan terhadap kondisi keuangan, kinerja operasi, dan likuiditas.</td><td>Damage or destruction of telecommunication towers due to natural disasters such as storms, floods, tornadoes, and earthquakes, as well as due to climate change, may affect services to customers. The adequacy of our interruption insurance may not be sufficient to cover all lost revenues, including potential revenues from new tenants that could have been added to the telecommunications towers had the damage not occurred. This could result in the loss of customers and adversely affect our financial condition, operating performance, and liquidity.</td></tr><tr><td>Mitigasi Mitigation</td><td>•Melakukan kolaborasi dalam proses pengadaan dan mendorong para mitra untuk mengimplementasikan perbaikan iklim dan kinerja carbon dalam operasi speerti pemanfaatan material tower non-baja(GFRP). 
•Efsiensi operasi dengan penerapan renewable energy speerti solar panel system, penggantian Valve Regulated Lead Acid (VRLA), revitalisasi genset, dan digitalisasi proses. 
•Mengambil sertifikasi ISO 14001:2015 ingin Townsend Sistem Manajemen Lingkungan. 
•Melaksanakan penilaian ESG Rating oleh eksternal. 
•Mentransfer risiko meng gunakan asuransi pada aset berisiko tinggi untuk mengantisipasi potensi bencana Alam.</td><td>•Collaborating in the procurement process and encouraging partners to implement climate and carbon performance improvements in operations such as the utilization of non-steel tower materials (GFRP). 
•Operating efficiency by implementing renewable energy such as solar panel system, Valve Regulated Lead Acid (VRLA) replacement, generator revitalization, and process digitalization. 
•Taking ISO 14001:2015 certification on Environmental Management System. 
•Carrying out an external ESG Rating assessment.

Hal ini dapat mengganggu kemampuan untuk melaksananakan strategibisnisnya dan memengaruhi kondisi keuangan, kinerja operasi,dan likuiditas.</td><td>Difficulty in recruiting, training, retaining and motivating key trained personnel in the telecommunications tower industry, due to the scarcity of trained personnel and intensified competition and gaps related to equal employment opportunities, occupational safety, access to health facilities, education, human rights, diversity and fair wages. # Tinjauan atas Efektivitas Penerapan Sistem Manajemen Risiko

Perseroan melakukan tinjauan secara Berkala untuk memastikan dan mencatingkatan efektivitas tersebut manajemen risiko ke depannya. Evaluasi terhadape efektivitas implementasi manajemen risiko dilakukan melalui proses berikut.

1. Pengukuran Risk Maturity Index (RMI).  
2. Monitoring dan evaluasi atas efektivitas mitigasi risikomelalui aplikasi Enterprise Risk Management Online (ERM Online). ERM Online digunakan oleh seluruh unit untuk pengelolaan risk register.  
3. Evaluasi/diskusi dan advisory secara one-on-one,dengan pemilik risiko seksual kebutuhan.  
4. Pelaporan dan evaluasi bersama dengan Direksi dan Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko.

Selain itu, untuk memastikan pelaksanaan manajemen risiko yang efektif, Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi melalui Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko secara rutin menjadi rapat dengan Unit Manajemen Risiko. Rapat tersebut membrakes telah pemantuaan risiko di lingkungan Perseroanuminium tindak lanjut yang telah dilakukan oleh pemilik risiko untuk memiminalkan potensi dampak. Hasil pemantuaan risiko dilaporkan oleh Unit Manajemen Risiko kepada Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris secara Berkala setiap triwulan.

# Review on the Effectiveness of Risk Management System Implementation

The Company conducts periodic reviews to ensure and improve the effectiveness of risk management implementation in the future. Evaluation of the effectiveness of risk management implementation is carried out through the following process.

1. Risk Maturity Index (RMI) measurement.  
2. Monitoring and evaluation of the effectiveness of risk mitigation through the Enterprise Risk Management Online (ERM Online) application. ERM Online is used by all units for risk register management.  
3. One-on-one evaluation/discussion and advisory with risk owners as needed.  
4. Jointreporting and evaluation with the Board of Directors and Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring.

Furthermore, to ensure effective implementation of risk management, the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors through Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring regularly hold meetings with the Risk Management Unit. The meetings discuss the risk monitoring results within the Company as well as follow-up actions taken by risk owners to minimize potential impacts. The risk monitoring results are reported by the Risk Management Unit to the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners on a quarterly basis.

# Pernyataan Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi atas Penerapan Sistem Manajemen Risiko

Pada tahun 2024, Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi menyimpulkan telahsystem manajemen risiko Perseroan telah berfungsi secara optimal, sesuai dengan kebjakan yang ditetapkan dan standar yang berlaku. Penilaian tersebut mencakup menjadi asepukama sebagaiberikut.

1. Kecukupan Sistem Manajemen Risiko

Sistem manajemen risiko yang dijalankan telah mengaku kerangka ISO 31000:2018 untuk memastikan implementasi terbaik dari suatu manajemen risiko. Penyusunan risk register dan risk profile Perseroan telah memantaatkan aplikasi ERM Online, yang juga digunakan dalam proses monitoring dan evaluasi.

2. Kecukupan Proses Identifikasi, Pengukuran, Pemantauan, dan Pengendalian Risiko

Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris melalui Unit Audit Internal telah makukan pemeriksaan, evaluasi, pelaporan, ada memberikan rekomendasi perbaikan terkait kecukupan dan efektivitas proses manajemen risiko. Selanjutnya, telah evaluasi ditindaklanjuti melalui pembahasan oleh Komite Evaluasi dan Monitoring Perencanaan dan Risiko untuk memastikan pelaksanaan yang optimal.

# Statement of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors on the Implementation of Risk Management System

In 2024, the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors concluded that the Company's risk management system functioned optimally, in accordance with established policies and applicable standards. The assessment covers several key aspects as follows.

1. Adequacy of Risk Management System

The Company's risk management system refers to the ISO 31000:2018 framework to ensure the best implementation of risk management. The preparation of the Company's risk register and risk profile has utilized the ERM Online application, which is also used in the monitoring and evaluation process.

2. Adequacy of Risk Identification, Measurement, Monitoring, and Control Processes

The Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners through the Internal Audit Unit have examined, evaluated, reported, and provided recommendations for improvement regarding the adequacy and effectiveness of the risk management process. Furthermore, the evaluation results are followed up through discussion by Committee for Planning and Risk Evaluation and Monitoring to ensure optimal implementation.

# Code of Ethics

Perseroan membrilki Kode Etik yang disebut sebagai Etika Bisnis Perusahaan menjadi pedoman yang berlaku bagi seluruh insan Perseroan dalam menjalankan perannya pada rantai nilai perusahaan. Penetapan Etika Bisnis Perusahaan berdasarkan Peraturan Direksi No. C.Tel.015/HK 200/ JDMT-1056000/2022tentang Etika Bisnis Perusahaan yang ditandatangani Direktur Utama pada 31 Mei 2022.

The Company has a Code of Ethics referred to as the Company's Business Ethics as a guideline that applies to all Company personnel in carrying out their roles in the company's value chain. The establishment of the Company's Business Ethics is based on the Board of Directors Regulation No. C.Tel.015/HK 200/JDMT-1056000/2022 on the Company's Business Ethics, signed by the President Director on May 31, 2022.

# Bentuk Sosialisasi dan Upaya Penyebarluasan Etika Bisnis Perusahaan dan Pakta Integritas

Perseroan menerapkan strategi komprehensif untuk mensosialisasikan Etika Bisnis Perusahaan kepada selurh kanyakan di berbagai level melalui media online dan offline. Para pemimpin bertanggung jawab mengumunikasikan Etika Bisnis Perusahaan serta memastikan pengawasan implementasinya. Sosialisasi mencaku prinsip anti-suap, anti-korupsi, anti-pencucianuang, pencegan pendanaan terorisme, penghindaran pajak, dan aturan pengendalian ekspor yang mengacu pada prinsip-prinsip Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) untuk mencatkan kesadaran dan pemahaman kanyakan.

Perseroan juga telah menetapkan pakta integritas dan memastikan prinsip-prinsipnya tersampaikan ke seluru tingkatan manajemen dan staft melalui penyebaran sistematis bagiakan e-mail dan intranet. Materi yang disampaikan mencakup elemen utama dalam Pedoman GCG,seperti etika bisnis, pencegahan fraud, manajemen risiko, pengendalian internal (SOA), mekanisme whistleblowing system, pelarangan gratifikasi, tata kelola TI, perlindungan keamanan informasi, serta aspek lain yang mendukung praktik tata kelola perusahaan yang baik.

# Pernyataan telah Eureka Bisnis Perusahaan Berlaku bagi Seluruh Tingkatan Organisasi

Perseroan memastikan bahwa Etika Bisnis Perusahaan berlaku setara dan wajib dipatuhi bagi Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan seluruh kanyakan, yang ditandai dengan penandatanganan wajib pada pakta integritas. Penandatangan pakta integritas oleh seluruh kanyakan tahun 2024 dilakukan pada September 2024.

# Upaya Penegakan Etika Bisnis Perusahaan

Perseroan memastikan kepadahan terhadap Etika Bisnis Perusahaan melalui berbagai mekanisme pengawasan dan penegakan. Unit Audit Internal secara rutin kepadakan pemeriksaan untuk memastikan pelaksanaan aturan, termasuk anti-suap, anti-korupsi, anti-pencucian uang, pencegahan pendanaan terorisme, dan penghindaran pajak. Fungsi manajemen risiko dan kepadahan juga kepadakan penilaian risiko secara bergala dengan mengacu pada prinsip-prinsip OFAC guna menjamin kepadahan terhadap ketentuan yang berlaku.

# Forms of Dissemination and Efforts to Distribute the Company's Business Ethics and Integrity Pacts

The Company implements a comprehensive strategy to disseminate the Company's Business Ethics to all employees at various levels through online and offline media. Leaders are responsible for communicating the Company's Business Ethics and ensuring supervision of its implementation. Dissemination includes anti-bribery, anti-corruption, anti-money laundering, prevention of terrorism financing, tax avoidance, and export control rules referring to the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) principles to increase employee awareness and understanding.

The Company has also established an integrity pact and ensured its principles are conveyed to all levels of management and staff through systematic dissemination using e-mail and intranet. The material covers the main elements of the GCG Guidelines, such as business ethics, fraud prevention, risk management, internal control (SOA), whistleblowing system mechanism, prohibition of gratification, IT governance, information security protection, and other aspects that support good corporate governance practices.

# Statement that the Company's Business Ethics Apply to All Levels of the Organization

The Company ensures that the Corporate Business Ethics apply equally and are mandatory for the Board of Commissioners, the Board of Directors, and all employees, as evidenced by the mandatory signing of the integrity pact. The signing of the integrity pact by all employees in 2024 took place in September 2024.

# Efforts to Enforce the Company's Business Ethics

The Company ensures compliance with Corporate Business Ethics through various supervision and enforcement mechanisms. The Internal Audit Unit regularly conducts inspections to ensure the implementation of regulations, including anti-bribery, anti-corruption, anti-money laundering, terrorism financing prevention, and tax avoidance. The risk management and compliance functions also perform periodic risk assessments based on OFAC principles to ensure adherence to applicable regulations.

The types of complaints that can be submitted on the Mitratel Integrity Line include:

1. Accounting and internal control issues over financial reporting that could potentially result in material misstatements in the Financial Statements;  
2. Audit issues, especially those concerning the independence of the public accounting firm;  
3. Violations of laws and regulations and capital market regulations relating to the Company's operations;

4. Violations of internal regulations that could potentially result in losses to the Company;  
5. Fraud and/or abuse of position and/or allegations of corruption committed by officers and/or employees of the Company;  
6. All actions of the Company's officials, employees that are included in money laundering and other suspicious financial transactions that have the potential to violate Anti-Money Laundering and Prevention of Financing of Terrorism (AML-CFT) regulations;  
7. Any actions of the Company's officers, employees that lead to terrorism activity funding schemes and/or any business relationships with individuals or companies that are known or suspected to be terrorists or terrorist/ criminal organizations or listed on the blacklist of AML/ CFT regulators or law enforcement officials;  
8. All actions of officers, employees of the Company that lead to tax evasion or avoidance;  
9. Any actions or activities of officers, employees of the Company involving individuals or entities subject to economic sanctions, which may potentially violate the sanctions and export control policies with due regard and cross reference to the principles generally established by OFAC; and  
10. Behavior of the Board of Directors and Management that is not commendable and has the potential to tarnish the Company's reputation or cause losses to the Company. Disgraceful behavior of the Board of Directors and Management includes dishonesty, conflict of interest with the Company, or providing misleading information to the public.

Every report submitted must be submitted by the reporter with a full sense of responsibility and not slanderous in nature that can defame a person's good name or reputation. Therefore, to maintain this principle, complaints received and which will be followed up at least contain:

1. Complaints are submitted in writing;  
2. Contains the identity of the reporter (the Board of Commissioners will maintain the confidentiality of the reporter's identity);  
3. Information that provides clues about the reported issue such as where, when, and who is involved in the issue; and

4. Informasi harus didukung dengan bukti-bukti yangcekup dan dapat diandalkan sebagai data awal untuk makukan pemeriksaan lebih lanjut.

Pengaduan yang membutuhkan pendalaman dilakukan melalui pemeriksaan oleh Unit Audit Internal atop uiahak independen jika diperlukan. Hasil pemeriksaan disampaikan kepada Komite Audit dan Direktur Utama sebagai laporan untuk ditindaklanjuti. Jika diperlukan, Komite Audit dapat menunjuk pihak independen untuk investigasi lanjutan, dengan persetujuan Dewan Komisaris. Apabila Dewan Komisaris tidak menuyetujui penggunaan pihak independen, investigasi internal dilakukan sesuai prosedur yang berlaku.

# Protection for Whistleblowers

Mitratel guarantees and ensures the protection of the confidentiality of whistleblowers, both employees and third parties who submit complaints or reports of alleged violations. Mitratel always prioritizes confidentiality and the presumption of innocence in following up every complaint or report submitted.

# Handling Procedures and Parties Managing Violation Reports

Handling of complaints in Mitratel Integrity Line is carried out in stages and includes several stages. The unit responsible for receiving reports monitors complaints from various channels and conducts verification to ensure the validity of the report. Eligible complaints are further processed according to the level of involvement, such as complaints involving members of the Board of Directors or Board of Commissioners, submitted to the Audit Committee or President Director with a copy to the relevant party. If the complaint involves employees or work partners, the report is handled by the Audit Committee, President Director, and Internal Audit Unit.

Complaints that require deepening are examined by the Internal Audit Unit or independent parties if necessary. The examination results are submitted to the Audit Committee and President Director as a report for follow-up. If necessary, the Audit Committee may appoint an independent party for further investigation, with the approval of the Board of Commissioners. If the Board of Commissioners does not approve the use of an independent party, the internal investigation is conducted in accordance with applicable procedures.

Meanwhile, the investigation process as a follow-up to the Preliminary Audit Report is conducted by the Internal Audit Unit in collaboration with the Investigation Committee formed by the President Director. The Investigation Committee reviews the issues to determine the need for experts or other assistance, especially if it involves a Subsidiary. If necessary, the investigation team may involve internal personnel or experts to prepare the Investigation Report. The report is submitted to the President Director and/or Audit Committee for evaluation and follow-up as needed.

# - Kebijakan Keterlibatan Politik

Political Involvement Policy

Mitratelunjung tinggi hak asasi setup kanyakan seksagai warga negara untuk mencapaikan aspirasi sosial dan politiknya. Namun demikian, untuk menjaga profesalisme, netralitas, dan meldhindari konflik kepentingan, seluruh;bentuk keterlibatan politic oleh kanyakan dibatasi sebagaimana diatur dalam Peraturan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.018/HK 200/JDMT-1056000/2022tentang Peraturan Perusahaan, dan Peraturan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No.C.Tel.015/HK 200/JDMT-1056000/2022tentang Etika Bisnis Perusahaan. Kanyakan tidak diperkenankan menjadi anggota ataupengurus partai politik,meng gunakan jabatan ataupasilitas perusahaan untuk kegiatan politik, maupun melakukan aktivitas politik yang dapat memengaruhi kinerja dan kepentingan perusahaan.

Mitratel upholds the fundamental rights of all employees as citizens to express their social and political aspirations. However, to maintain professionalism, neutrality, and avoid conflicts of interest, all forms of political involvement by employees are restricted as stipulated in the Board of Directors' Regulation of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel.018/HK 200/JDMT-1056000/2022 on Company Regulations, and No. C.Tel.015/HK 200/JDMT-1056000/2022 on the Company's Code of Business Ethics. Employees are prohibited from becoming members or administrators of political parties, using their positions or company facilities for political activities, or engaging in political actions that could affect the company's performance and interests.

Throughout 2024, no Mitratel employees were involved in political activities, and no company funds were allocated or used to support political activities in any form.

# - Kebijakan Perlakuan Adil Terhadap Pemegang Saham

Policy on Fair Treatment of Shareholders

Berdasarkan Peraturan Direksi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel. 019/HK 200/JDMT-1340000/2022 tantal Pedoman Pengelolaan Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Mitratel Group, kebikan ini memastikan kepada hak-hak Pemegang Saham dilindungi dan diperlakukan secara adil dan setara. Dalam implementasinya, Mitratel mencunjung tinggi prinsip kesetaraan (equal treatment) kepada seluruh Pemegang Saham, di mana:

1. Setiap Pemegang Saham memiliki perilakuan yang sama atau setara tanpa diskrimasi dalam bentuk apa pun.  
2. Setiap Pemegang Saham dengan hak suara yang sah berhak menjadi ppaikan pendapat atas mengeluarkan sua sesuai dengan jumlah saham yang dimilikinya.  
3. Setiap Pemegang Sahamberhak memperoleh informasi yang lengkap, akurat, dan tersebut waktu mengenai kegiatan dan kondisi perusahaan.

MitrateljugakebijakantegasyangmelarangDewanKomisaris, Direksi, dan seluruh kanyakan untuk mengambil keuntungan dari informasi material yang tidak tersedia secara umum diasar (non-public information). Berdasarkan Pedoman Pengelolaan GCG dan ketentuan internal perusahaan, orang dalam dilarang makukan hal-hal berikut.

1. Mempengaruhi pihak lain untuk makukan pembelian ata penjalan efek berdasarkan informasi yang dimiliki.  
2. Memberikan informasi orang dalam kepada pihak lain yang diduga akan menc gunakan informasi tersebut untuk melakukan transaksi efek, baik pembelian maupun penjalan.

Based on the Board of Directors' Regulation of PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk No. C.Tel. 019/HK 200/ JDMT-1340000/2022 on Mitratel Group's Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Management Guidelines, this policy ensures that Shareholders' rights are protected and treated fairly and equally. In its implementation, Mitratel upholds the principle of equal treatment to all Shareholders, where:

1. Every Shareholder has the same or equal treatment without discrimination of any kind.  
2. Each Shareholder with valid voting rights has the right to express opinions or cast votes in accordance with the number of shares they own.  
3. Each Shareholder has the right to obtain complete, accurate, and timely information regarding the Company's activities and conditions.

Mitratel also has a strict policy prohibiting the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, and all employees from taking advantage of material information that is not generally available in the market (non-public information). Based on the GCG Management Guidelines and internal company regulations, insiders are prohibited from doing the following.

1. Influencing other parties to purchase or sell securities based on the information possessed.  
2. Providing inside information to other parties who are suspected of using the information to conduct securities transactions, either purchases or sales.

# - Kebijakan untuk Mencegah Terjadinya Insider Trading

Policy to Prevent Insider Trading

Perseroan telah memiliki kebijakan untuk mencegah terjadinya insider trading yang tercanrum dalam Pedoman Pengelolaan Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Mitratel Group dan Peraturan Direksi tersebut Pakta Integritas. Kebijakan ini bertujuan untuk menghindari benturan kepentangan antara Perseroan dengan pihak-pihak tertentu, memastikan perdagangan efek Perseroan yang wajar, melindungi Perseroan dalam melaksananaksi korporasi, seda mencatur penggunaan informasi material yang tidak ataubelum menjadi informasi publik oleh setiap pihak yang memiliki akses atas informasi material atau informasi rahasia.

The Company has a policy to prevent insider trading as outlined in Mitratel Group's Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Management Guidelines and the Board of Directors' Regulation on Integrity Pact. This policy aims to avoid conflicts of interest between the Company and certain parties, ensure fair trading of the Company's securities, protect the Company in carrying out corporate actions, and regulate the use of material information that is not or has not become public information by any party that has access to material information or confidential information.

# - Pedoman Transaksi Afiliasi dan Benturan Kepentingan

Guidelines for Affiliated Transactions and Conflict of Interest

Perseroan memahami pentingnya menerapkan sikap tegas dalam menjentari penturan kepentangan di lingkungan perusahaangunam mendukung terciptanya GCG, memperkuat hubungan harmonis dengan seluruh pemangku kepentangan, seda mendorong penengkatan nilai Perseroan secara berkelanjutan. Dengan tujuan tersebut, Perseroan telah menuyusun Prosedur Transaksi Afliasi dan Transaksi Benturan Kepentingan yang ditetapkan pada 12 November 2021.

# Transaksi Afliasi

Transaksi yang berpotensi oleh tergolong sebagai transaksi afliasi yaitu aktivitas oleh transaksi antara Mitratel (sebagai perusahaan terbuka) dengan pihak yang memiliki hubungan afliasi. Afliasi dapat berupah hubungankeluarga, kepada melikan saham, kesamaan pengendali, oleh keterlibatan Direksi dan Komisaris dalam perusahaan yang bertransaksi.

The Company understands the importance of implementing a firm stance in handling conflicts of interest within the Company to support the creation of GCG, strengthen harmonious relationships with all stakeholders, and encourage sustainable increase in the value of the Company. With this aim, the Company has prepared the Procedures for Affiliated Transactions and Conflict of Interest Transactions stipulated on November 12, 2021.

# Affiliated Transactions

Transactions that are potentially or classified as affiliated transactions are activities or transactions between Mitratel (as a public company) and parties that have an affiliated relationship. Affiliation can be in the form of family relationships, share ownership, common control, or involvement of Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners in the transacting company.

Jenis transaksi afliasi yang diatur meliputi:

1. Penyertaan modal dalam perusahaan lain;  
2. Pembelian, penjualan, ata tukar-menukar aset;  
3. Penyediaan dan penerimaanjasa;  
4. Sewa-menyewasa set;  
5. Pinjam-meminjam Dana dan penjaminan aset; dan  
6. Pemberian jaminan perusahaan (corporate guarantee).

Types of affiliated transactions that are regulated include:

1. Capital participation in other companies;  
2. Purchase, sale, or exchange of assets;  
3. Provision and receipt of services;  
4. Lease of assets;  
5. Lending of funds and pledging of assets; and  
6. Provision of corporate guarantees.

Untuk memastikan telah transaksi afliasi dilakukan secara transparan dan seksuai dengan prinsip GCG, Mitratel menerapkan prosedur sebagai berikut.

1. Identifikasi dan klasifikasi, yaitu unit pelaksana melakukan identifikasi transaksi dan mengklasifikasikan apakah transaksi masuk dalam kategori transaksi afliasi.  
2. Koordinasidengan Investor Relations, yaitusemuarecanata transaksi harus dikonsultasikan dengan Unit Investor Relations, yang akan melakukan analisis lebih lanjut.  
3. Evaluasi dan persetujuan:

a. Jika transaksi memerlukan penilaian kewajaran,RIA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,MA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA,RA  
b. Untuk transaksi yang tidak memerlukan persetujuan Pemegang Saham Independen,cekup dilakumanterbukaan informasi kepada Otoritas Jasa Keuangandan publik.  
c. Jika transaksi melebihi batasan nilai tertentu ata berisiko terhadap kelangsungan usaha, makaprelu mendapatkan persetujuan Pemegang Saham Independen dalam RUPS.

4. Pengungkapan dalam Laporan Tahunan, yaitu semuTRANSaksi yang signifikan harus dicantumkan dalam Laporan Tahunan sebagai bagai bagian dari keterbukaan informasi.

# Transaksi Benturan Kepentingan

Transaksi Benturan Kepentinganteringi ketika terdapat perbedaan antara kepentingan ekonomi perusahaandengan kepentingan pribadi pihak internal,seperti Direksi, Dewan Komisaris,atu Pemegang Saham Utama dan Pengendali yang dapat merugikan perusahaan. Transaksi benturan kepentingan mencakup:

1. Transaksi dengan afliasi yang berpotensi merugikan perusahaan;  
2. Keputusan investasi atas akuisisi yang menguntungkan individu tertentu di dalam perusahaan; dan  
3. Penyewaan aset atajasa dengan kondisi yang;tidak wajar.

Untuk memastikan telah transaksi dilakukan secara transparan dan seksuai dengan prinsip GCG, Mitratel menerapkan prosedur tersebut berikut.

1. Identifikasi potensi benturan kepentingan yang dilakukan oleh unit pelaksana sebelum transaksi dilakukan.  
2. Jika diperlukan, transaksi akan dievaluasi oleh penilai independen untuk memastikan nilai dan ketentuan yang wajar.

3. Adanya persetujuan dari Pemegang Saham:

a. Jika transaksi berpotensi merugikan perusahaan, makarhus mendapatkan persetujuan Pemegang SahamIndependen dalam RUPS.  
b. Jika tidak memerlukan persetujuan RUPS, transaksi tetap harus diumumkan secara terbuka kepada Otoritas Jasa Keuangan dan publik.

4. Semua transaksi dengan potensi benturan kepentingan harus terdokumentasi dengan jelas dan dicantumkan dalam Laporan Tahunan.

To ensure that affiliated transactions are conducted transparently and in accordance with GCG principles, Mitratel implements the following procedures.

1. Identification and classification, where the implementing unit identifies transactions and classifies whether the transaction falls into the category of affiliated transactions.  
2. Coordination with Investor Relations, i.e. all transaction plans must be consulted with the Investor Relations Unit, which will conduct further analysis.  
3. Evaluation and approval:

a. If the transaction requires a fairness assessment, it will involve an independent party (appraiser);  
b. For transactions that do not require the approval of Independent Shareholders, it is sufficient to disclose information to the Financial Services Authority and the public.  
c. If the transaction exceeds a certain value limit or poses a risk to business continuity, it is necessary to obtain the approval of Independent Shareholders in the GMS.

4. Disclosure in the Annual Report, i.e. all significant transactions must be included in the Annual Report as part of the information disclosure.

# Conflict of Interest Transactions

Conflict of Interest Transactions occur when there is a difference between the economic interests of the Company and the personal interests of internal parties, such as the Board of Directors, Board of Commissioners, or Major and Controlling Shareholders that can harm the Company. Conflict of interest transactions include:

1. Transactions with affiliates that have the potential to harm the Company;  
2. Investment or acquisition decisions that favor certain individuals within the Company; and  
3. Leasing of assets or services with unreasonable conditions.

To ensure that transactions are conducted transparently and in accordance with GCG principles, Mitratel implements the following procedures.

1. Identification of potential conflicts of interest conducted by the implementing unit prior to the transaction.  
2. If necessary, the transaction will be evaluated by an independent appraiser to ensure fair value and terms.

3. Approval from the Shareholders:

a. If the transaction is potentially detrimental to the Company, it must obtain the approval of Independent Shareholders in the GMS.  
b. If it does not require GMS approval, the transaction must still be announced publicly to the Financial Services Authority and the public.

4. All transactions with potential conflicts of interest must be clearly documented and included in the Annual Report.

# - Kebijakan Komunikasi

# Communication Policy

Perseroan telah menetapkan kebijakan komunikasi dengan Pemegang Saham yang dituangkan dalam Pedoman Pengelolaan Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Mitratel Group sebagai panduan dalam Berkumunikasi dengan Pemegang Saham, Otoritas Pasar Modal, dan komunitas pasar modal. Pedoman ini dirancang untuk memastikan bahwa Perseroan menyediakan informasi yang lengkap, akurat, terkini, tidak menyesatkan, mudah diakses, dan sesuai dengan ketentuan perundang-undangan yang berlaku. Selain itu, pedoman kebijakan komunikasi juga bertujuan untuk menjamin perilakuan yang adil kepada seluruh Pemegang Saham, terutama tersebut pemenuhan hak-hak sebagai Pemegang Saham Perseroan.

The Company has established a communication policy with Shareholders as outlined in Mitratel Group's Good Corporate Governance (GCG) Management Guidelines as a guide in communicating with Shareholders, the Capital Market Authority, and the capital market community. This guideline is designed to ensure that the Company provides information that is complete, accurate, current, not misleading, easily accessible, and in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. In addition, the communication policy guidelines also aim to ensure fair treatment to all Shareholders, especially regarding the fulfillment of their rights as Shareholders of the Company.

# - Kebijakan Tata Cara Pengunduran Diri Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Apabila Terlibat Kejahatan Keuangan

Policy on Procedures for Resignation of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors if Involved in Financial Crimes

Perseroan menetapkan kebijakan tata cara pengunduran diri Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi apabila terlibat kejahatan keuangan sebagai bagian dari komitmen untuk mengimplementasikan dan melaksanan prinsip-prinsip GCG secara optimal dan komprehensif di seluruh kegiatan usaha. Setiap anggota Dewan Komisaris dan/atau Direksi diwajibkan untuk mencampaikan pengunduran diri dari jabatanya kepada Perseroan apabila anggota Dewan Komisaris dan/atau Direksi tersebut telah terbukti terlibat dalam kejahatan keuangan. Kebijakan ini telah diatur dalam Anggaran Dasar Mitratel, jo. Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan No. 33/POJK.04/2014.

The Company establishes a policy on the procedure for resignation of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors if involved in financial crimes as part of the commitment to implementing and executing GCG principles optimally and comprehensively in all business activities. Each member of the Board of Commissioners and/or Board of Directors is required to submit his/her resignation from his/her position to the Company if the member of the Board of Commissioners and/or Board of Directors has been proven to be involved in financial crimes. This policy has been regulated in Mitratel's Articles of Association in conjunction with Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014.

# Prinsip 4: Perilaku Etis dan Bertanggung Jawab

Principle 4: Ethical and Responsible Conduct

# Rekomendasi 4.1: Pedoman Etika dan Perilaku.

Recommendation 4.1: Code of Conduct.

<table><tr><td>Rekomendasi 4.1.1:</td><td>Recommendation 4.1.1:</td></tr><tr><td>Pernyataan ini dituangkan dalam Pedoman Perilaku dan Etika Usaha yang HARUS seceha jelas mengungkapkan harapan korporasi oleh setup anggota Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris tersebut kanyakawan akan: 
1. Bertindak untuk kepentingan terbaik korporasi; 
2. Bertindak dengan jujur dan dengan integritas berstandar tinggi; 
3. Bersikap independen dan bertindak berdasarkan informasi yang lengkap, dengan iktikad baik, dengan uji tuntas dan kehati-hatian; 
4. Mematuhi peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku bagi korporasi dan operasianya; 
5. Menghindari tindakan yang melanggar peraturan perundang- undangan untuk tindakan yang tidak etis berdasarkan pedoman etika korporasi; 
6. Tidak terlibat untuk berpartisipasi dalam kegiatan apa pun yang akan memimbulkan benturan kepentingan dengan kepentingan terbaik korporasi untuk yang akan berdampak negatif terhadap reputasi korporasi; 
7. Tidak mengambil manfaat atas properti untuk informasi yang dimiliki korporasi, kepada bilan yang untuk pelangganya untuk kepentingan pribadi untuk yang menyebabkan kerugian bagi korporasi dan pelangganya; 
8. Tidak memanaftikan jabatanya untuk peluang yang dihasikan oleh jabatanya untuk kepentingan pribadi; 
9. Menghindari perputan meminta untuk menerima dari pihak ketiga pembayaran, gratifikasi untuk keuntungan lain untuk dirinya sendiri untuk orang lain yang menimbulkan benturan kepentingan/ memberikan keuntungan kepada pihak ketiga secara melanggar peraturan perundang- undangan; 
10. Menghormati perbedaan pendapat dan hak-hak setiap anggota Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, dan kanyakawan; dan 
11. 2. Act honestly and with a high standard of integrity; 
3. Be independent and act based on complete information, in good faith, with due diligence and prudence; 
4. Comply with laws and regulations that apply to the corporation and its operations; 
5. Avoid actions that violate laws and regulations or unethical actions based on corporate ethics guidelines; 
6. Not be involved or participate in any activity that will create a conflict of interest with the corporation&#x27;s best interests or have a negative impact on the corporation&#x27;s reputation; 
7. Not take advantage of property or information owned by the corporation, ownership of other assets, or its customers, for personal gain or in a way that causes harm to the corporation and its customers; 
8. Not take advantage of the position or opportunities generated by the position for personal gain; 
9. Avoid the act of requesting or receiving payments, gratuities, or other benefits from third parties for oneself or others that would lead to conflicts of interest or provide benefits to third parties in violation of laws and regulations; 
10. Respect differences of opinion and the rights of each member of the Board of Directors, Board of Commissioners, and employees; and 
11. Social and Environmental Responsibility

# - Komitmen Keberlanjutan Mitratel

Mitratel's Commitment to Sustainability

![](https://cdn-mineru.openxlab.org.cn/result/2025-10-20/7b47834f-578f-4c20-9349-926bb925d718/de909dfff18a3156eb3a825822049d0e2fe897488210d6e08c61aa152fd3dd6c.jpg)

Mitratel berkomitmen penuh terhadap keberlanjutan, dengan berlandaskan 3 pilar utama, yaitu Right Governance, Right Environmental Approach, dan Right Communication (Social). Pilar-pilar iniunjadi panduan strategis sekalisgus wujud tekad Perseroan untuk memberikan dampak positif bagi pemangku kepentingan dan lingkungan.

Prinsip keberlanjutan telah diintegrasikan ke dalam inti strategi bisnis dan operasional Perseroan guna mendukung pertumbuhan jangka panjang, memperkuat reputasi,{serta menjaga keseimbangan antara tujuan bisnis dan tanggung jawab sosial maupun lingkungan. Komitmen ini diwujudkan melalui program Tanggung Jawab Sosial dan Lingkungan (TJSL) yang berfokus pada kesejahteraan masyarakat di wilayah operasional Perseroan, pemenuhan harapan dan hak karyawan,{serta pelestarian lingkungan hidup. Pendekatan holistik ini mencaskan keberlanjutan sebagai bagian integral dari pertumbuhan dan kontribusi Mitratel bagi masyarakat dan lingkungan.

Mitratel is fully committed to sustainability, based on 3mainpillars, namely Right Governance, Right Environmental Approach, and Right Communication (Social). These pillars serve as a strategic guide and a manifestation of the Company's determination to create a positive impact on stakeholders and the environment.

The principle of sustainability has been integrated into the core of the Company's business and operational strategies to support long-term growth, strengthen its reputation, and maintain a balance between business objectives and social and environmental responsibilities. This commitment is realized through the Social and Environmental Responsibility (TJSL) program, which focuses on community welfare in the Company's operational areas, fulfillment of employee rights and expectations, and environmental conservation. This holistic approach reinforces sustainability as an integral part of Mitratel's growth and contribution to society and the environment.

Hal audit utama (lanjutan)

Pengakuan pendapatan

Penjelasan atas hal audit utama:

Pendapatan Grup untuk tahun yang berakhir pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 sebesar Rp9,3 triliun, terutama berasal dari penghasilan sewa atas menara telekomunikasi dan jasa jaringannya sebesar Rp8,7 triliun. Pendidapatan sewa dari pelanggan diakui sebagai pendapatan secara sistematis dengan dasar garis lurus selamajangka waktu sewa yang mencerminkan pola manfaat dari aset pendasar yang menurun. Pemenuhan kewajiban pelaksanaan untuk jasa tersebut mungkin dilakukan@cukup lama sebelum penerbitan faktur kepada pelanggan, Seeingga terdapat risiko pendapatan dicatat dengan dokumen pendukung yang belum sepenuhnya memadai.

Pendapatan merupakan ukuran penting yang digunakan untuk mengevaluasi kinerja Grup dan merupakan faktor utama yang mendorong profitabilitas. Pendapatan dapat diakui secara tidak kepada untuk menc Gatkan telah usaha dan mencapai pertumbuhan pendapatan sejalan dengan tujuan Grup, Seeingga menc Gatkan risiko kesalahan penyajian material. Karena signifikansi keuangannya, kesalahan penyajian atas pendapatan dapat memiliki dampak substansial pada laporan keuangan konsolidasian secara keseluruhan dan keputusan yang dibuat oleh para pemangku kepentingan. Oleh karena itu, pengakuan pendapatan merupakan hal audit utama bagi kami. Catatan 2 dan 30 pada laporan keuangan konsolidasian terlampir menyajikan pengungkapan atas pendapatan Grup.

Independent Auditor's Report (continued)

Report No 00400/2.1032/AU.1/06/1563-4/1/III/2025 (continued)

Key audit matter (continued)

Revenue recognition

Description of the key audit matter:

The Group's revenue amounting to Rp9.3 trillion for the year ended December 31, 2024, was primarily comprised lease income of its telecommunication towers and network services amounting to Rp8.7 trillion. Lease revenues from customers are recognized systematically as revenue on a straight-line basis over the lease term reflecting pattern in which the benefit of the underlying assets diminished. The satisfaction of the performance obligation for these services may took place considerably earlier than the issuance of invoices to the customers, which poses a risk of recognizing revenue based on incomplete supporting documentation.

Revenue is an important measure used to evaluate the performance of the Group and is the main driver of profitability. Revenue may be inappropriately recognized to improve business results and achieve revenue growth in line with the objectives of the Group, thus increasing the risk of material misstatement. Due to its financial significance, misstatement in revenue can have a substantial impact on the overall consolidated financial statements and the decisions made by stakeholders. Accordingly, revenue recognition is determined as a key audit matter. Notes 2 and 30 to the accompanying consolidated financial statements provide the relevant disclosures on the Group's revenue.

Pengakuan pendapatan (lanjutan)

Respons audit:

Kami mangevaluasi dan menguji rancangan dan efektivitas kendali utama atas proses pendapatan. Atas dasar sampel, kami makukan pengujian rinci pisahatas transaksi menjelang dan setelah tanggal 31 Desember 2024 untuk memastikan oleh停留在 dicatat pada periode yang sesuai. Atas dasar sampel, kami makukan pengujian rinci atas pengakuan penghasilan sewa ke dokumen pendukung utama untuk memastikan keterjadian atas pendapatan serta telah diakui sesuai dengan standar akuntansi yang berlaku dan dicatat pada jumliah dan periode yang kepada. Kami juga mengirim konfirmasi kepada peluangkan atas dasar sampel untuk syarat-syarat tertentu pemenuhan kewajiban pelaksanaan atas jasa yang belum ditagih pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 sebagai dasar pengakuan penghasilan sewa.

Kami juga melakukan pengujian rinci dengan menentukan akun buku tersebut yang digunakan untuk mencatat entri antara pendapatan, piutang usaha beserta liabilitas kontrak, dan kas dan bank, serta seksungan korelasi (pencatatan entri jurnal) antara akun-akun tersebut untuk melakukan kombali (reperformance) pematatan entri jurnal. Kami melengkapi prosedur ini dengan pengujian informasi yang dihasilkan oleh Grup atas entri jurnal kas untuk memastikan Bahwa kasterebut adalah kas sebenarnya yang berasil dari pelanggan. Kami jugaMMCalevaluasi kelayakan dan kecukupan penyajian dan pengungkapan yang relevantasitas pendapatatan atas kontrak dengan pelanggan dalam layoran keuangkan konsolidasian terlampir.

Independent Auditor's Report (continued)

Report No 00400/2.1032/AU.1/06/1563-4/1/III/2025 (continued)

Key audit matter (continued)

Revenue recognition (continued)

Audit response:

We evaluated and assessed the design and operating effectiveness of the key controls over the revenue process. On sample basis, we performed detailed cut-off testing of the transactions occurring near and after the year-end December 31, 2024 to ensure that such transactions were recorded in the proper period. On sample basis, we performed test of details of the lease income to supporting documentation to ensure the occurrence of the revenue and whether it has been recognized in accordance with the applicable accounting standards and recorded in the proper amount and period. We also sent confirmations to customers on a sample basis to confirm specific terms of satisfaction of performance obligation for unbilled services as of December 31, 2024 as the basis for lease income recognition.

We also performed test of details by identifying which general ledger accounts are used to post entries among revenue, trade receivables along with contract liabilities, and cash and banks and use the correlation (journal entry postings) among those accounts to reperform the posting of journal entries. We supplemented this procedure with testing of the information produced by the Group over cash journal entries to ensure they are real cash from customers. Moreover, we evaluated the appropriateness and adequacy of the presentation and the relevant disclosures regarding revenue from contracts with customers in the accompanying consolidated financial statements.

Risiko tidak terdeteksinya suatu kesalahan penyajian material yang disebabkan oleh kecurangan lebih tinggi dari yang disebabkan oleh kesalahan, karena kecurangan dapat melibatkan kolusi, pemalsuan, penghilangan secara sengaja, pernyataan salah, atas pengabaian atas pengendalian internal.

Independent Auditor's Report (continued)

Report No 00400/2.1032/AU.1/06/1563-4/1/III/2025 (continued)

Auditor's responsibilities for the audit of the consolidated financial statements

Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements taken as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an independent auditor's report that includes our audit opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with Standards on Auditing established by the IICPA will always detect a material misstatement when it exists. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of such consolidated financial statements.

As part of an audit in accordance with Standards on Auditing established by the IICPA, we exercise professional judgment and maintain professional skepticism throughout the audit. We also:

- Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statements, whether due to fraud or error, design and perform audit procedures responsive to such risks, and obtain audit evidence that is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our audit opinion. The risk of not detecting a material misstatement resulting from fraud is higher than for one resulting from error, as fraud may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omissions, misrepresentations, or override of internal control.

Ketika kami mencywabwa terdapat suatu ketidakpASTIAN material, kami diharuskan untuk menarik perhatian dalam laporan auditor independen kami kepengungkapan terkait dalam laporan keuangan konsolidasian kepada, jika pengungkapan tersebuttidak memadai,memodifikasi opini kami. - Evaluate the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates and related disclosures made by management.  
- Conclude on the appropriateness of management's use of the going concern basis of accounting and, based on the audit evidence obtained, whether a material uncertainty exists related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the Group's ability to continue as a going concern. If we conclude that a material uncertainty exists, we are required to draw attention in our independent auditor's report to the related disclosures in the consolidated financial statements or, if such disclosures are inadequate, to modify our opinion. However, future events or conditions may cause the Group to cease to continue as a going concern.

# 1 INFORMASI UMUM

# a. Pendirian Perseroan

PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk. ("Perseroan"), yang sebelumnya bernama PT Dayamitra Malindo, didirikan pada tanggal 18 Oktober 1995 berdasarkan Undang-Undang Penananan Modal Asing Republik Indonesia No. 1 tahun 1967, yang telah diubah dengan Undang-Undang No. 11 tahun 1970, dengan persetujuan dari Presiden Republik Indonesia dalam Surat Keputusan No. B-576/Pres/10/1995 tanggal 16 Oktober 1995. Anggaran Dasar Perseroan di akta notariskan dengan Akta No. 50 tanggal 18 Oktober 1995 dari H.M. Afdal Gazali, S.H., Notaris di Jakarta. Anggaran Dasar tersebut disahkan oleh Menteri Kehakiman dengan Surat Keputusan No. C2-13273 HT.01.01.Th 95 tanggal 19 Oktober 1995. Perseroan menjangan namanya dari PT Dayamitra Malindo menjadi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi dengan Akta Notaris Hendra Karyadi, S.H., No. 53 tanggal 28 Agustus 1997. Selanjutnya berdasarkan Keputusan Kepala Badan Koordinasi Penanaman Modal No.244/T/ Perhubungan/ 2006 tanggal 22 Maret 2006, telah ditetapkan perubahan status Perseroan semula sebagai Penananan Modal Asing menjadi Penananan Modal Dalam Negeri.

# 1 GENERAL INFORMATION

# a. Establishment of the Company

PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk. ("the Company"), previously known as PT Dayamitra Malindo, was established on October 18, 1995 in the framework of the Republic of Indonesia Foreign Investment Law No. 1 of 1967, as amended by Law No. 11 of 1970, with the approval of the President of the Republic of Indonesia in Decree No.B-576/Pres/10/1995 dated October 16, 1995. The Company's Articles of Association are notarized by Notarial Deed No. 50 dated October 18, 1995 from H.M. Afdal Gazali, S.H., Notary in Jakarta. The Articles of Association were ratified by the Minister of Justice's Decision Letter No. C2-13273 HT.01.01.Th 95 dated October 19, 1995. The Company changed its name from PT Dayamitra Malindo to PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi by Notarial Deed from Hendra Karyadi, S.H., No. 53 dated August 28, 1997. Furthermore, based on the Decree of the Head of the Investment Coordinating Board No. 244/T/ Perhubungan/ 2006 dated March 22, 2006, the change of the Company's status as foreign investment has changed to domestic.

Tahun 2021, tanggal 23 Agustus 2021tentang Persetujuan Perubahan Anggaran Dasar Perseroan Terbatas PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk. dan surat nomor AHU-AH.01.03-0439750 tanggal 23 Agustus 2021tentang Penerimaan Pemberitahuan Perubahan Anggaran Dasar PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk., dimana para pemegang saham Perseroan memutuskan dan menyetujui perubahan mengenai status Perseroan dari perseroan tertutup menjadi perseroan terbuka, yang padaNama Perseroan ditambah singkatan Tbk, SeeinggaNama Perseroan menjadi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk.

# 1 GENERAL INFORMATION (continued)

# 1 INFORMASI UMUM (lanjutan)

# b. Maksud dan Tujuan Perseroan

Maksud dan tujuan Perseroan dan entitas anaknya (selanjutnya disebut "Grup") adalah menjalankan usaha yang bergerak di bidang bisnis menara telekomunikasi beserta ekosistemnya termasuk jasa penunjang digital untuk mobile infrastructure, serta optimalisasi pemanfaatan sumber daya yang dimiliki oleh Perseroan.

Untuk mencapai maksud dan tujuan tersebut di atas Perseroan dapat melaksanakan kegiatan usaha utama sebagai berikut:

- Instalasi Telekomunikasi;  
Konstruksi Sentral Telekomunikasi;  
Aktivitas Telekomunikasi dengan Kabel;  
Aktivitas Telekomunikasi tanpa Kabel.

Selain kegiatan usaha utama Perseroan dapat melakukan usaha penunjang sebagai mertuang di dalam Anggaran Dasar mengenai maksud dan tujuananya kegiatan usaha sebagai berikut:

- Konstruksi  
Bangunan Sipil

unk

- Aktivitas Teknologi Informasi dan Jasa Komputer lainnya.  
- Instalasi kepada Pemasangan Mesin dan Peralatan Industri.  
Konstruksi Bangunan Sipil Elektrikal.  
- Pembangkitan Tenaga Listrik.

# b. Purpose and Objective

The purpose and objective of the Company and its subsidiaries (collectively referred to hereinafter as the "Group") is to carry out business in the telecommunications sector and its ecosystem including digital support services for mobile infrastructure, as well as optimizing the utilization of the Company's resources.

To achieve the aforementioned purposes and objectives, the Company may carry out main business activities as follows:

Telecommunications Installation;  
Telecommunication Central Construction;  
Telecommunication Activities with Cable;  
Telecommunication Activities without Cable

In addition to the main business activities, the Company may carry out supporting businesses as stated in Articles of Association regarding the aims and objectives and business activities as follow:

# c. Kegiatan Perseroan

Perseroan memulai kegiatan operasinya pada tahun 2008. Masing-masing tersebut tahun 2008 dan 2010, Perseroan melakukan kegiatan bisnis membrangun dan menyewakan sarana telekomunikasi kepada operator jasa telekomunikasi. Juga sejak tahun 2010, Perseroan melakukan jasa pemeliharaan untuk sarana telekomunikasi milik operator jasa telekomunikasi di Indonesia.

Perubahan terakhir dalam rangka perubahan susunan Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan tertuang di dalam Akta Pernyataan Keputusan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Luar Biasa PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk. No. 2 tanggal 1 Desember 2023 yang dibuat dihadapan Notaris Ashoya Ratam, S.H., MKn, yang telah diputuskan dan disetujui para pemegang saham Perseroan dalam Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Luar Biasa PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk. tanggal 1 Desember 2023. Akta Pernyataan Keputusan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham Luar Biasa tersebut dalam database Sistem Administrasi Badan Hukum Departemen Hukum dan Hak Asasi Manusia Republik Indonesia berdasarkan surat nomor AHU-AH.01.09-0192675, tanggal 5 Desember 2023tentang Pemerimaan Pemberitahuan Perubahan Data Perseroan PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk.

Pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024, Vice President Internal Audit Perseroan telah Asyraf Thirafi Ramdhani, penunjukan sebagai Vice President tersebut berdasarkan Surat Keputusan Direktur Utama tanggal 28 September 2023, dimana Surat Keputusan Direktur Utama tersebut telah mendapat persetujuan dari Dewan Komisaris Perseroan.

# 1 INFORMASI UMUM (lanjutan)

# d. Manajemen Kunci dan Informasi Lainnya (lanjutan)

Berdasarkan Risalah Rapat Direksi Terbatas tanggal 26 Agustus 2021, Perseroan telah memutuskan untuk menetapkan Direktur Investasi merangkap jabatan sebagai Sekretaris Perseroan dimana keputusan tersebut berlaku-Sejak penggangkatan Hendra Purnama sebagai Direktur Investasi yaitu sejak tanggal 31 Agustus 2021.

Jumlah kanyakan dan pengurus Grup untuk posisi tanggal 31 Desember 2024 dan 31 Desember 2023 masing-masing seabanyak 579 dan 412 kanyakan (tidak diaaudit) termasuk masing-masing seabanyak 28 dan 29 kanyakan (tidak diaaudit) Telkom yang diperbantukan dengan remunerasi ditanggung oleh Perseroan.

# e. Penawaran Umum Efek Perseroan

Berdasarkan Akta Pernyataan Keputusan Pemegang Saham Diluar Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham (Sirkuler) No. 31 tanggal 21 Agustus 2021 dari Notaris Fathiah Helmi, S.H., para pemegang saham Perseroan memutusan dan menyetujui:

- Perubahan mengenai status Perseroan dari perseroan tertutup menjadi perseroan terbuka, yang mana pada akhirNama Perseroan ditambah mata singkatan Tbk seesinggaNama Perseroan mencdi PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk.  
- Perubahan Pasal 3 Anggaran Dasar Perseroan tersebut maksud dan tujuan serta kegiatan usaha agar dapat sejalan dengan Klasifikasi Baku Lapangan Usaha Indonesia.  
- Peningkatan modal dasar Perseroan yang semula berjumlah Rp18.240.000 menjadi Rp50.160.000 kepada setara dengan 220.000.000.000 lembara saham dengan nilai nominal saham Rp228 (nilai penuh) per saham.

# d. Key Management and Other Information (continued)

Based on the Minutes of the Board of Directors' Meeting on August 26, 2021, the Company has decided to appointed Director of Investment as the Corporate Secretary where the decision is effective since the appointment Hendra Purnama as Director of Investment effective as of August 31, 2021.

The number of employees and management of the Group for the positions as of December 31, 2024 and December 31, 2023 are 579 and 412 employees (unaudited), respectively, including 28 and 29 Telkom employees (unaudited), respectively, who are seconded with remuneration borne by the Company.

# e. Public Offering of Shares of the Company

Based on the Deed of Statement of Shareholders' Decisions Outside the General Meeting of Shareholders (Circular) No. 31 dated August 21, 2021 of Notary Fathiah Helmi, S.H., the shareholders of the Company decided and approved:

- Company from a private company to a public company, where at the end of the Company's name the abbreviation Tbk is added so that the Company's name becomes PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk.  
- Amandement Article 3 of the Company's Articles of Association regarding the aims and objectives as well as the Standard Classification of Indonesian Business Field  
- The increase of the Company's authorized capital which was previously Rp18,240,000 to become Rp50,160,000 or equal to 220,000,000,000 shares with the par value shares Rp228 (full amount) per share
